1.content:
You stand at in the foyer of your large mansion, pacing back an forth. When you bought your mansion you thought that it wouldn't be that hard to keep it clean, and as much as you hate to admit it, you were wrong. You had to much work to do to keep things tidy, make sure the plant were watered, tend to the garden and let alone take the time to prepare yourself a decent meal. So you decided to hire some help, but only what you thought was necessary.

The number one thing that needed to be addressed was the lack of food, because there was no way that you would last much longer due to the lack of food in your tiny stomach.

The girl you hired to make sure that both you And your new employes was the highly recommended twenty two year old Kelly. From what you heard she she was a fantastic chef and was normally quite professional, as long as you liked her food that is. She would often get mad and go of to practice her cooking not giving the person who disliked the dish she severe, until she is sure that she has improved, but if you insulted one of her greater works she would get sad and comfort eat until she felt better. You were also told that she was on the plus side, but that didn't sound so odd for some one with her job. From the picture you saw of her you thought that she was rather cute, she had blond hair that went down just past her shoulders. She had blue eyes that went well with her hair. She was flashing a bright smile, revealing her pearly white teeth. Judging by the objects in the picture you would say that she was at least five and a half feet tall. She had a not very big, but still noticeable belly on her, confirming that she was plus sized (if she was even big enough to be called that).

The next thing that would need to be taken care of and was only slightly less important then the need for food to operate, and that was the need to have a clean home. You had hired three maids hired to help with that.

The head maid's name is Jennifer, she had only ever worked at one home but that was because she was so good at her job that she was never replaced, but recently the mistress of the house became suspicious that had had been sleeping with the master of the house (which she didn't) and she was fired. Her references all said that she is a sweet, kind and innocent girl who would never do something that she thought was wrong (these being the masters, her friends and families words, not not the mistress's). Jennifer came with a little more info then Kelly. She is five foot nine, she weighed a hundred twelve pounds. She has brown hair and eyes and is twenty four. From her picture you could tell that she is very attractive, she had a nice smile and a cute button nose, she had a tiny body...well except for her nice b- you cut off your own impure thoughts and slapped your self for drooling (or what you called drooling) over a girl you don't even know.

The other maid you hired name is Gracie. From what you heard she was a huge flirt, she had been know to tease her master or mistress with sultry comments, but never did any thing. Despite being a huge flirt she was very kind and understanding. She is twenty three She is rather short only being an inch shorter than five feet. She was a normal weight for some one her age but because of her height was a bit pudgy. She has short red hair and hazel eyes.

The last maid you hired was Alex, new to being a maid she did not have much experience, then again you didn't have much experience hiring them, but she seemed like a nice girl in need of a job so you gave her one. She seemed like the kind of girl who kept to herself and might be a little shy. She has black hair and green eyes. She is rather tall, being six foot three inches, you and her were about the same height. In her picture she was wearing rather loose clothes that kept her body covered, but even through her baggy clothes that she has a very large re- 'Stop doing that!' You yell in your head. 'If I keep thinking like this their all going to want to quit because they'll think I'm a huge pervert!'

The least urgent matter was the state the plants around your home were in, so you hired a gardener named Beth, two years ago when Beth was only nineteen, her husband Phil, was shot and killed in a mugging. Since then she spends all of her time working, and hasn't really said much to any one since then ether. She is a dirty blond with blue eyes that always seem sad.

Suddenly you realize some thing. You had hired an All. Female. Staff! Now you knew that they were going to think you were a perv. Lately you haven't been acting like your self. You've been forgetful, messy, and...pervy! You walk over to a near by mirror, look at yourself and ask allowed.

"Who are you?"

Norman.L, a nice, witty, smart, young man. You have never been quite good with the lady's and, despite trying you've never had "long term relationship" but that will eventually change with all these women around...hopefully.

Lisa.B, a sweet, innocent, young woman with a taste for cute girls. You have never be quite open about your sexuality with any one, but something about the sweet girls who now work for you makes you want to change that.

Or, pick another way to start,

A. Same start, but with deffernt girls.

B. Your rich father has just passed (he hadn't even mention that he was sick until now,) and you inherit his money, mansion and find out he had a staff of those women already working for him. (This choice also means a slightly different backstory for you and some of the girls.)

Or pick from even More ways to start.

Edit: The proportions of the girls have been changed to be more realistic.
1.title: Who are you?

choices: Your new cook Kelly. "Where's my kitchen?"
Your new head maid Jennifer. "Oh, I'm sorry I shouldn't have said that."
The flirty maid Gracie. "You're kind of cute, crazy, but cute!"
The newbie maid Alex. "I'm sorry, I probably took that out of context."
11.content:
The more you thought about you realized that what sounded so profound in your head, was flat out stupid allowed.

You were just a man who, through, (choice for later chapter) [A. One long streak of good luck] (or) [B. Constant grooming by your grandfather] had gained a large, ever replenishing wealth, but other then that you're not much different from any other guy. You've never been a lady's man, you've had some relationships before but they were nothing to special. In you're own mind your mind you're only mildly attractive (though in reality you're quite the looker) but despite that you've never really had the confidence to talk to many girls,

11.title: Just a humble man.

111.content:
Kelly shook her head, as if she were shaking off any doubts, before she asked, "Where's my kitchen."

"Y-You're bigger than your picture," you blurt out, then immediately curse yourself. But it was true. Whereas the Kelly Dewit in the photo could barely be considered plus-sized, the one standing in front of you was approaching "chubby." Her clothes were a size or two smaller than what they should have been, tightly constricting a pair of soft, chunky legs and a large, round potbe—

You stopped yourself right there. You straighten yourself up. Kelly was looking at you with a bemusedly concerned look in her blue eyes.

"I-I'm sorry, you just… caught me by surprise! And, um… uh—"

"I was thinner in my photo?"

"Well, it's… um… it's—"

"Wonderful, isn't it?" Kelly said with a smile.

It was as if every joint in your upper body suddenly disappeared. You're jaw went slack, you're arms dangled down, and your shoulders slumped, all in confusion. "Wait, what?"

Kelly giggled with amusement. "I've been trying to gain weight for a month now. It seems like I've been making good progress, if you can notice it." Kelly smiled. "Now, where's my kitchen."

It takes you a minute to digest this information. You put it away for further consideration and point to your right. "Down the hall, to your left."

"Great!" And with that, Kelly skipped along to her new kitchen.

***

Who arrives next?
111.title: Kelly—Larger Than Life.

You watch as Kelly saunters in to the kitchen, your eyes helplessly drawn to her thick thighs. Graced with a touch of cellulite, the soft legs had a nice wobble to them.

"Um hello..."

"Huh Wha!" you panic caught in the act of staring at your new chef's plump legs.

"Oops sorry. Didn't mean to catch you off guard like that." apologized the dirty blonde girl.

"No, I was just uh--making sure the chef found the kitchen. That's all." you nervously chuckle. "Anyway can I help you?"

"Yeah, I'm Beth, your gardener."

"Oh yes very good. Let me show you the yard."

Norman led to girl around back. As they walked you manage to get a good look at her. Beth was wearing a tank top with a worn out pair of jeans. Her hair was dirty blonde and fashioned in a pony tail reaching below her shoulders. She had blue eyes that seemed unusually blank. She had a nice bust at least d cup which filled her tank top nicely. Armed with a slender build with a firm butt, Beth was quite the looker though her sad eyes would suggest otherwise.

You bring Beth to a huge yard decorated with various plants. "Think you can handle it?"

"This suits me actually. I've grown used to spending my days in the garden." Beth said assuming her role.

You leave Beth to her work to direct the other employees. By the time you get back you find...

113.content:
You turn around to face a girl standing in the door way.

"Hey you're kind of cute! Obviously crazy, but cute!" The girl walked up to you and got a little to close.

"You must must be Gracie, my names Norman Leroy," You said, outstretching your hand for a hand shack. "But you can call me Mr.Norman.L."

"Are you trying to cop a field," You quickly throw your hand in the air as if to say "Of course not!" but she was it as a "Oops, you cought me!" and she gigged. "I didn't say I minded, Mr.Normal!."

You slap your palm to your face. "That's not at all what I said," You take your hand off your face and walk to the main stair way. "Come on, I'll show you to the bed room!" Your eyes widen and you turn back to face Gracie again. "You're bedroom, not The bedroom, You're bed room," You said correcting your self before Gracie had a chance to make a sultry comment. "We don't share One bedroom, every one gets their own!"

Gracie just giggled as she walks toward you, suitcase's in hand. "It's okay, simple mistake," She said as she began to walk up the stairs. "Although it would be nice if it wasn't." She said swaying her hips all the way up to her room.

"Okay if you need any thing just ask." You said just before you left Gracie in her room.

"I thought I was supposed to say that?" Joked Gracie after you left.

You had left Gracie in her room to unpack her stuff and learn her schedule. Onece you got back into the foyar you saw another girl waiting there.

With one final tug you yank it open, but in the process you sent most of the items it contained onto the floor.

Now it could have been one of two things, the fact that you had just seen a pair of Jennifer's frilly red panties lying on the floor Or the fact that you hadn't eaten any decant amount of food in a week, most likely the latter but the former might of bad something to do with it. After about ten seconds of stumbling around you were just to dizzy to stay up and you fell to the floor slamming your face into the wall, knocking yourself out.

When you finally woke came to some time later you found that it was thanks to...

11331.content:
"*sniff...sniff sniff, sniff~* I...smell...brown-brownies?" Your eyes opened and shut over and over until you finally realized what was going on, you had passed out from hunger, and some one had brought you food to get you to wake up.

"Oh good your up! What happened to you," Asked Jennifer. "Did I say or do something?"

"Ugh, um. . .No no no, you didn't do anything! I must have passed out from hunger, I've been so buried in paper work this week that I haven't had time to eat or drink any thing...or sleep."

All three girl in the room got a shocked look on their faces and they were all probably wondering how you were still alive. Wait a second, three girls? Last Ike you checked their were only two in the house, so who was this third girl? You gave her the once over and determined that it was Kelly, she must have been the one to make the brownies that awoke you.

"Um, are those brownies for me?" You asked as you weakly pointed at the plate Kelly was holding.

"Well they Were supposed to be for all of us, but I guess you need them more then any of us do." Kelly handed you the plate and waited in anticipation for you to tell her what you thought of them.

Choice one. "This is wonderful!" Kelly is happy with your response and you finish the brownies to get back to full strength.

Choice two. "This is fantastic, here you all have to try!" Kelly is very happy with your response, and you feel bad about keeping them to yourself and have to share them with the others. Once you're finished with your share you're still no a hundred percent, at least it's better then being back a zero.

"Are you sure? You do seem to still be a little weak." Asked Jennifer as she took a brownie.

"No I'm fine now besides, these are just too good, I'd feel bad if I didn't share." You say as you take another bite out of your brownie and passed out the rest of them.

"Mmmm! These are even better then you made them sound," Said Gracie with a expression of joy. "So Miss Kelly, are you going to serve these a lot?"

"Oh yes, sweets are my favorite dishes to make!" Kelly said, overjoyed that every one liked her food.

"Really? Oh man I am going to get so fat working here," Gracie placed her hand on her stomach and patted it. "And you wouldn't like that, would you Mr.Normal?"

Kelly made a confused look apear on her face. "Normal? That's a strange name!"

"Yes it is, especially since that's not my name!" After what you said you realized that Kelly hadn't eaten any of the brownies and offers her to eat some.

While it was true that she was bigger then most girls you wouldn't say that she was fat, and you tried to comfort her about her weight. You thought as you shifted your focus toward Gracie.

"No I wasn't and yes I'm sure!" After that every one in the room began laughing, even you! Except for Jennifer that is, she just stayed quite and kept a strange expression on her face while in deep thought.

"Wait, if you haven't seen the kitchen, where did you make the brownies?"

"So if didn't bring those brownies, I might have not woken up?!?!" You asked.

Kelly got up to leave but not before answering your question. "I wouldn't say that, Jennifer was taking really good care of you, she brought you here to make sure you were okay." When Kelly left you realized three things, one was that you were moved to the infirmary. 'how did I not notice that sooner?' Two was that you should have probably hired a doctor too, and three was that Jennifer must have carried you in here.

You were now alone with Jennifer in the infirmary and you decided to thank her by,

B. Giving her a friendly peck on the cheek to express your thankfulness, and when you do her cheeks go a very, very deep shade of red.

"You were making sure I was okay? You took care of me?" You asked, walking over to Jennifer.

"Yes, I didn't want my new master to die on my first day...sorry, I mean I wanted you to be okay."

"Please don't call me master, I don't like the way it sounds, it makes me feel like I own the person who says it." You said sincerely..

"Oh, then what should I call you?" She asked.

"Well my name would be a good choice." You joked.

"Mr.Normal?" She joked back.

"YOU KNOW THAT'S NOT MY NAME," You yell, taking her joke Way to seriously. "Oh sorry, but ah, just call me Norman," You got closer to Jennifer a smiled. "Again, thank you so much for making sure I was okay." You leaned over and gave her a tiny peck on the cheek and to make sure she thought it was only a thank you (which would be in vain) patted her on the head a smiled. Jennifer eyes widened and her cheeks went bright red and her mouth was slightly agape.

"I okay I'm going to go see how the others are doing okay?...Jennifer?...Are you okay?" Jennifer just stood there with the same look on her face, not moving or making any sound, like she was frozen in time or something. 'Oh shit I broke her!' You yelled in your head.

While you were trying to get Jennifer to snap out of it, Kelly and Garcia were inside of the dining room.

"So do you think their doing it? Asked Gracie.

"What?! She's only been here a few hours, most of that time he was unconscious, and you think he moves so fast that he's all ready got her naked?" Asked Kelly, shooting Gracie a look.

"Yes I do."

"No, I don't believe it, he seems to kind to do that."

As if on cue you started swearing and making noises while trying to snap Jennifer out of her trance, that without knowing the situation, could sound wrong.

"Okay maybe their doing it."

While Gracie was busy tainting Kelly mind, you were still trying to get Jennifer to come back to reality.

'Is she so embarrassed that she just shut down?' "Come on snap out of it!"

After that Jennifer began to open and shut her eyes over and over.

"Uh, what?" Said Jennifer trying to figure out what happened.

"Oh I'm sorry, I...I was just kind of tur-ah I-I mean aro-no. S-surprised, I don't handle being...surprised very well," Jennifer said stumbling with her words. 'That was a close one, I almost said some thing stupid.' "Um, you're welcome anyways."

"Okay well, I should go check on the others."

Jennifer nods and leave to go see______

"So have you seen your new kitchen," You ask as you came into the dining hall. You saw the Kelly was Seeming to mind her own business, but Gracie couldn't stop smiling and giggling. "Okay, what's going on!"

"You lasted longer then I thought you would!" Gracie managed to get out between laughs.

"What dose that mean?" You asked.

"You were really loud too," Gracie said looking at Kelly. "We could hear you from all the way in here, Jennifer was Really quiet though."

"…………No no no! That is not what happened, At All!" You said after finally putting two and two together.

"Hm, I thought that you were into big girls." Said Gracie.

"I AM NOT INTO BIG GIRLS!!! And I'm not even talking to you, you are a lost cause, I'm trying to get Kelly to not think that's what happened." You could already tell that these girls were not going to be good for your voice.

"Don't worry, my minds not As bad as hers." Replied Kelly, but something about how she phrased that was...unsettling.

"Um, okay. So have you seen the kitchen yet?"

"No not yet, but I was about to."

"Okay, come with me, I'll show it to you."

You took Kelly into the kitchen, leaving Gracie to do what ever it is Gracie dose when she's left alone.

"Wow, this place is massive," Said Kelly as she walked into your kitchen. She turned to you with tears in her eyes. "D-did, I, die on my way my new job?" She asked starting to cry.

"No no, of course not your still alive, why would you even ask that?" You replied.

"Because I thought that I was in heaven, this, this is the greatest kitchen I've ever seen, um one more question, will I be working with other chefs, or will I be on my own."

"No no, unless you want some that is."

"NO! Um I mean I work better on my own, wow this place is perfect! Um, can angels lie?"

"Still think that this is heaven?"

"Yes."

"No I'm pretty sure they can't. Oh, I know think about it this way! If this I am a angel then I can't lie to you. This. Isn't. Heaven!"

"Well, if that's true then I have to be alive, because this kitchen is to nice to be in the other place, and I'm also to polite to end up there in the first place," 'That Is true, hell she didn't even say the word...like I just did.' You laughed.

"Hmm, but this is still to good to be true, I must be dreaming!"

You sighed. You walked over to Kelly a pinched her in her pudgy arm and she yelped out in pain. "Are you convinced yet?"

Kelly's smile grew even brighter. "YOU ARE THE BEST BOSS EVER," She screamed and you could basically feel Gracie's mind going to work on twisting that around. "I'm going to get started on something very spiecal for your dinner!"

"Well, just make enough for every one!" You said as you made your way out of the kitchen.

"Wait? You serve the same food you eat to your servants? You really Are the best boss ever!"

"Don't say servants, it makes it sound like I own them!" You said as you made your way back to your foyer.

Once you got there you saw Gracie talking to a girl who had arrived.

It's Alex, and Gracie had all but convinced her that you are a giant pervert/sexual deviant.

It's Beth and Gracie is having a one sided conversation with her about how you've already slept with two of the girls that were here.

"No I'm not! I want you, I don't know why but I do! Please, sleep with me!"

"No no, I won't, we haven't even gone on a date, I haven't even known you for a full day! You said in protest.

"Oh I get it, I'm not fat enough for you, am I? Is the little pudge that I've already got still too skinny for you? Because if you want me to I'll put on some weight for you!" She was now basically bargaining for you to sleep with her.

For once you kept a level head about her remark. "No no, you don't have to do that , you look nice no matter your size, and I already told you why we shouldn't, we don't know each other and we haven't gone on a single date! It would be a mistake."

Gracie sulked her head down in defeat after all, you did have a Very good point, but then you saw a metaphorical lightbulb go off in her head. "So why don't we fix that? Take me out, maybe this weekend or something."

"*sigh* Alright, but on a few conditions," Gracie nodded her head and you continued. "First, when were done here you're going to tell Alex that it was all a joke that went wrong and that you're sorry," Gracie agreed. "Second, you will cut on the jokes at my expense." Once again she agreed. "Lastly, you will lay off the suggestive jokes around Jennifer and Alex, they don't seem to be as comfortable about them as me and Kelly," This time Gracie took a little bit more time to think about but she ultimately agreed.

"Okay, then it's a deal, now I don't know about this weekend, I still have a lot of work to do but, no that I have a bit of incentive, I'll try for it." Gracie smiled and you both walked out of the room.

"So do you really think I'd look good at any size?"

"Yeah, you just look like have one of those faces."

"So even if I gained a hundred pounds you'd still think I was pretty?"

"Yes I would."

"What if I lost twenty?" Before you had time to mistakingly answer, No, you heard Kelly yell, at what had to be the top of her lungs,

"DINNER IS READY!!! GET IT WHILE IT'S HOT, COLD AND MILED!"

"Wow she can be lou-*growl*. Oh yeah, all I've really eaten in the past week is some crackers and that brownie."

"Oh yeah, man if her dinners are any where as good as her desserts, I might gain that hundred pounds after all."

Once you got to the dining room you had Gracie go talk to Alex. Jennifer was sitting at the table and began blushing when you entered the room, but you didn't pay it much attention, what you Did pay attention to was,

Choice 1, Beth was sitting next to her. Beth has finally arrived, and Jennifer figures out you had hired a all female staff felling a strange feeling...is it jealousy, or could it be something more complicated.

Choice 2, Beth still isn't here yet, well she's actually been here since ten this morning, about a hour before Gracie, and has been in the garden the whole time, and Jennifer was blushing because she really, Really likes you.

She is a Very gifted artist but she doesn't like to talk about it much though, so if you see her drawing in her down time don't look at it unless she offers to show you.

Bethany is the gardener, you should now the rest.

I suggest you come the mansion as soon as you can, incase you forgot the address is ________(once again the writing was smudged) and if you need to call before you come the phone number is 3-555-255-3555.

I know that this might not get rid of all the bad blood between us, and that you still might be mad at me, but now that I'm here with only a few minutes left, I know that I have to do it anyways. I am s' On that S, the letter ends. "He must have died while he was still writing this...I guess I should honor his last request and go take things over." You looked around your messy apartment. "It's going to take me a while to he ready to move though."

After that you began packing, you sold you furniture and quit your old job (since you would have new furniture at your new house, along with with a new job). Looked in the mirror and,

Checked your hair, you are Norman. L.

14.title: Deferent start, same girls.

141.content:
It was raining the night you finally drove to your new home, (old if you were to get technical,) you pulled up to the front gate, put in a code and they swung open.

You parked your car in front of the entrance.

Once you opened your umbrella you walked up to the door, but before you could even knock they were opened by a young woman.

You opened your mouth to say hello but the girl hugged you before you could say a word. "I've missed you do much!"

A smile cane to your face and you hugged her back. "I've missed you too Beth."

"Here let me get a better look at you," Beth pushed you away and looked you up and down, taking in the suit that you were wearing. "Did you get all dressed up just for me?"

"Heh heh, actually in dads...letter, he said that there were four other girls here besides you." You replied nervously.

Beth blushed. "Oh I get it, you're trying to impress them aren't you!"

"No no, well yes but not the way you're thinking. I though that I should look as professional as possible for them since I'm their new boss...is that the right word for this?" You asked.

"Actually the word would be master." Replied Beth.

"Master? I don't like that. They should just use my name."

"You'll have to tell them that...so, what are you waiting for, get out of the rain and into your nice warm house."

After you shook off some rain from your umbrella you walked inside. It felt good to be back in your childhood home, a little weird, but good.

Beth sat you down in the foyer. "I'm sure you have a million questions, and I've got just as many answers so ask away!"

"Okay, I guess my first question is why dad didn't tell me he was sick."

"Truth is up until two mouths ago dad didn't even tell any of us he was, another month passed before dad told us it was terminal and well...last week...he-he...passed away and for the past month and a half ago he started to think more and he just thought it would be best not to bother you with his problems."

Almost completely unbothered by Beth's response, you asked your next question. "Alright then, so...why are you-er-why Were you working for dad?"

"I guess this would have to come out some time, two years ago...Phil was shot and killed during a mugging."

Your eyes went wide. "I-I can't believe it...Phil, Beth why didn't you tell me?!"

"I...I didn't want to worry you-"

Beth stopped talking when you hugged her. "Beth don't you Ever feel like you can't confide in me...I can't even imagine how horrible you must feel, losing the love of your life."

"I-it's okay, he wouldn't want me to spend the rest of my life missing him I mean, I still do but, I try not to dwell on it," Beth broke away from your embrace. "Anyways after Phil...passed, I got really sad, I couldn't afford to stay in our old home on my salary and well...long story short dad said that I could come stay with him and he offered me a job as the gardener...I really like it here so I figured that I should stay."

"Figures, he Would use you while you were vulnerable."

"It's not good to speak ill of the dead."

"Fine...then I guess I have one more question for now."

"And what would that be?"

"Well, where am I going to sleep?"

"We're still getting dads room ready so for now in you're old room...do you remember how to get there?"

"Of course, speaking of which I think I'm going to turn in now...you should get some rest too."

You gave Beth a pat on the back and went of to you're old room.

Once you got there you heard some one come up behind you.

You spun around and saw,

Jennifer, the head maid.

Gracie, the short flirty maid.

Alex, the shy, artsy maid.

You pulled up to the massive mansion you would soon be calling home again. 'This place hasn't changed in years,' You thought as you parked you car at the entrance. 'Well, the plants look a better.' You opend the car door, pulled a box out of the passenger seat an carried it to the front door.

After struggling with box for awhile you finally gave up and just knocked on the door with your foot. When the door finally opend there was a attractive girl black hair that reached her shoulders in a maids uniform, the skirt was black with white frills going around the bottom. The top was black and had sleves that went to her wrist, and had white frills around her sleeves and neck, puffed out shoulders and a white apron that went down past the skirt. You shook your head and entered. "No no, I can handle it, my box anyways, it's not your problem," The girl honestly looked surprised at what you said. "You can tell me where I can put it down though...it is pretty heavy." The sighed and pointed to the side of the door.

After you put the box down you turned around to face the girl again and gave her a smile. "What ever, I'm Sophie your head maid, blah blah blah (she is actually saying blah blah blah), the master bedroom is at the top of the stairs, blah blah blah, I've go work to do and I don't really care what you do just don't make a mess...good bye." Sophie turned away from you and started to walk away but you grabbed her wrist before she could get far.

"I get the feeling you don't like me, why is that?" You asked.

Sophie her arm away from you. "I'm not going to waste my time explaining myself to some rich kid!" After Sophie stormed off you were left alone in the foyer.

'Well she's just a ray of sunshine,' You turned and picked up the box again 'Alright, time to get these up those stairs...this is not going to be easy.'

After you lugged the box up the stairs you put it down and opend the doors to the master bed room. Inside you saw yet another maid. She was wearing a similar outfit to Shopie only instead of being black, it was pink, but it also seemed to be a bit...tighter then the one on Sophie. The girl had white hair and pale skin...too pale to from a lack of sun, the girl was probably a albino. The girl didn't seem to notice you enter since she kept dusting...ether that or she just chose to ignore you.

You walked ovr to the girl and placed your hand on her shoulder, scaring her.

The girl jumped up and spun around. Your assumptions about her being albino were correct since she also had white eyes, she was beautiful, a bit pudgy, but still beautiful. She was shaking and looked afraid you. "No no, don't be afraid, I won't bite...that was lame, dose any one actually think, oh watch out, that freak is going to bite me," The girls fear started to melt away and she started to laugh. "That's better, you're the one person I've met today who doesn't seem to hate me...granted I've only meet one other girl today. Anyways my name is Norman, what's your name?"

The girl blushed and started to mumble her response. "He-hello Mr. N-Norman, m-my n-name is Ni-Nicole...hi."

"Nicole huh, that's a pretty name," 'AM I FLIRTING WITH A GIRL I DON'T EVEN KNOW...well she dose seem to apreciate the compliment.'

"Thank y-you...I-I should go...I don't w-want waste any more of y-your time, I-I have work to do anyways." Before you could say another word the girl rushed out of your room.

"That stupid rich kid, the late masters bed must not have been good enough for him, he must have-" Sophie opened the door to the kitchen to see you sitting there, eating a simple plate of waffles, while the heavyset woman in a white chefs outfit sitting next to you was having...more. When you saw Sophie you gave her a big smile and waved to her. Sophie turned around and faced you. "What do want stupid brat."

"I wanted to talk to you about that whole 'rich kid' thing, I'm just wondering what that's about, and don't say that you're not going to waste your time explaining it to me because if you don't I can't fix the problem."

"Hump, you want to know what the problem is? Fine, I'll tell you what the problem is," Sophie began poking you chest at every emphasized word. "That You're just a Selfish, Rich, Spoiled, Brat, who's Never had a Hard day in his life, and ran away from home because what You had, wasn't enough!"

"Would I have had Ilene help me make every ones favorite breakfast, even though I didn't get to see any one eat it, if I was selfish? Until a few days ago I wasn't even even rich, I was about to be fired form my job because of budget cuts, I was so far behind on my rent that I was going to be evicted from my one bed, one bath apartment and the car I had since I was sixteen, the one that I paid for with the money I earned from my old job, was about to be repossessed! My father absolutely refused to get me anything after I got my first job and I did not run away, I was kicked out a week after I graduated high school! As for the 'never had a hard day in his life' thing, I'm not even going to get into that, so if someone wants to be mad at me, I don't care, as long as you have a good reason and I don't consider false assumptions, a good reason!"

Sophie sunk her head down. "I-I'm sorry...I didn't know...I'll just go."

Sophie turned to leave but once again you stopped her. "No no, I'm sorry, I don't normaly snap like that, it's just...never mind, lets just pretend I never said anything, that way we can be friends, how about it?"

Sophie gave you a smile. "Sounds okay Mr. Norman, well anyways I've still got work to do so I better get-" *GROWL!*

"Heheh sorry but well, you didn't let me finish my waffles." You apologized for letting you stomach interrupt Sophie.

"It's okay, I'm getting a bit hungry too it must be lunch time by now," Sophie looked up at the clock at the door of your office. "Nine thirty?! You finished all of your work before lunch?!"

"Oh, so I guess I'm not as dumb as you pegged me to be!" You said as you got out of your chair.

"Nope, the late master could have done all of that in half the time you did, I guess that means you're just slow."

'Forever in his shadow.' "Alright then, what do you normally do around this time."

"Normally we all sit down for breakfast by this time but-"

"Awesome, now I get to finish my waffles And met the other girls!" You said as you walked to the door of your office.

"But I already-"

"I don't think you ate all of the French-toast, so you can have that if you want." Sophie mood seemed to change at the mention of French-toast and she followed you back to the dining room.

When you arrived back at the dining room you saw Ilene still eating away at her large breakfast (you were now beginning to understand how she got so big) but she was not eating alone, Nicole had joined her and she was quietly eating her meal of pancakes (the ones you lied about not making), and another girl that you hadn't seen yet, both sitting on the right side of the table across from Ilene. She was wearing the same kind of maids uniform as Sophie and Nicole, only it was blue instead of black or pink and she had brown hair that went half way down her back. You assumed that she was Ruby since she was eating the hash-brown breakfast you had prepared for her.

Sophie sat down on the left side of the table next to Ilene and got herself another plate of French-toast and another glass of orange juice. After you got another plate of waffles you decided to sit next to,

Nicole and Ruby, since you haven't actually had a real conversation with ether of them.

Ilene and Sophie, since you've actually become friends with them.
153132.title: A (French-)toast to new friends.

1531321.content:
After getting yourself an new plate of waffles you sat down next to Nicole.

"Are you enjoying your breakfast?" You asked with a big smile.

Nicole blushed as she swallowed a bit of her pancakes. "Yeah I am...Ms. Ilene said that you helped make all the food today."

"Well she did most of the actual cooking, I just told her some old recipes, which reminds me, later on I'll have to give Ilene a book that's full of old family recipes. I'm sure she could adapt them and make them even better."

"If they're like the ones we used earlier I could do a lot with them, so so you can all except a increase in the quality of the food I serve." Said Ilene before taking another bite out of her breakfast.

"You're going to add even more ingredients to your food? As if they weren't fattening enough." Said Ruby with a lovely British accent.

No one seemed bothers by Ruby's comment, except for Nicole.

She pushed her plate away and then looked down at her pudgy middle. She frowned as she poked it and began to mumble very softly. "Fatty, you're a big ugly fatty."

"I mean really, me Sophie and Miranda are the only girls who a are still thin." Ruby said before taking another bite of her food.

*Growl* "No, no more food for you." Nicole said to her stomach in her hushed voice, only this time Sophie took notice.

Sophie swallowed the bite of French-toast in her mouth before sh spoke. "Ruby, I think you sh-"

"Seriously, if we keep eating food like this we'll all be as big as Ilene and Nicole in a couple of months." Ruby said interrupting Sophie.

At this point Nicole looked like she was on the verge of tears. "Then how big will I be?"

Sophie looked angry now. "Ruby you need to stop talking you upsetting Nicole!"

Ruby looked to left and saw how sad Nicole was. "So what, not my fault she's fat."

"RUBY!!!" That was all Nicole could take, she got up from he chair and ran out of the diningroom crying.

"What is the matter with you?!" You yelled, finally stepping in.

"Sod off!" Ruby said before storming out of dining room as well.

"What is wrong with the people in this house?!" You said before going after,

Nicole. You go to comfort Nicole about her weight and end up finding out more about her.

Ruby. You go to confront Ruby about being so insensitive to Nicole and about being so rude to you.
1531321.title: Nicole and Ruby.

choices: The smell of Ilene food wakes you up.
1532.content:
You knocked on the front door of your old home and waited for someone to answer it. When the doors opened it was by a girl with very long white hair that went down all the way down her back. She also had white eyes and pale skin, and was undoubtably albino. She was in a maids uniform that looked a little tight on her, the skirt was pink with white frills going around the bottom. The top was pink and had sleves that went to her wrist, and had white frills around her sleeves and neck, puffed out shoulders and a white apron that went down past the skirt. She had very fair skin and a cute face, she was a bit pudgy but she was still very beautiful.

'Hello cutie, it is Very nice to meet you...do Not, say that aloud.' You thought to yourself. "Hello, my name is Lisa, what's your name." You said with a smile. 'That was much better.'

The girl smiled sheepishly back. "My name is Nicole, um, it's very nice to meet you."

"It's very nice to meet you too Nicole, that's a very pretty name by the way." You said sincerely.

"Really, um, thank you very much...oh! I'm sorry, please come in," Nicole blushed and stepped aside to let you in. "The other girls just went to bed, I was just finishing up some chores, so please try not to make too much noise okay, I'm sorry."

"Don't be, I'll make as little noise as possible." You said quietly.

"Thank you, um, would you like me to get you anything, maybe some tea?" Nicole asked.

"I am feeling a little peckish, could I have something to munch on, if it's not to much trouble that is."

Nicole shook her head. "Not at all...please wait here, I'll be right back." Nicole turned around and walked away, giving you a very good look at her large rear while she walked away.

You sat down in one of the love-seats 'Wow, she's really pretty, and she got a really-no, stop it now before you screw things up.' You thought to yourself while you waited for her to come back.

When Nicole walked back into the foyer a minute later she was holding a tray that had a plate of cookies and a glass of milk on it. "I hope these are okay, I'm not really good with preparing food, and these were the only thing that were ready, sorry."

"No it's fine, I love cookies," You took one of the cookies off the plate a took a bite. "Mmmm, these are great, do you want some?"

"Oh, um, you won't mind?" Nicole asked.

"Would I have offered you any if I did?"

"Oh, you're right, sorry." Nicole said before picking up a cookie.

"You shouldn't be, you didn't do anything wrong."

"Um, okay," Nicole looked at you and blushed but then quickly looked away. "Sorry um, I'm just a bit nervous, I'm not really good at meeting new people."

"You're just a little shy, don't worry about it."

"Thank you, for being so nice to me. I've been having a bad couple weeks since the late mast-Er, your father ...passed...sorry, I know you've probably had it worse though, he was your father after all."

"Don't feel bad, I'm sure that a lot of people miss him."

"Okay," Nicole looked down at the plate and all of the cookies had been eaten. "Oh, I guess I should get to bed now, I've go a busy morning and I think you do too."

"Alright, it was very nice to get to know you. I'll see you in the morning I guess." You got up from the love-seat and walked up to the master bedroom. You closed the door behind you before changing out of your clothes and laying down in the bed. 'I hope all the other girls here will be as nice as Nicole, as cute too.' You thought to yourself as you closed your eyes and went to sleep.

In the morning you were woken up by,

Nicole, she is your personal servant after all.

Sophie, she has a lot of work for you to do.

Ilene, it's not her that wakes you up but the smell of her food.
1532.title: Lisa.

choices: You don't and you meet another girl.
15321.content:
'I hope Ms. Lisa slept well, she was so nice to me last night, I don't want her to get angry at me for waking her up with out her getting enough sleep.' Nicole thought as she walked up to your bedroom door and opened it. She quietly walked over to the window and pulled open the currents. "Ms. Lisa, it's time to-" When Nicole turned from the window to face you her face went red and she covered her eyes with her hand.

While you slept you must have gotten too warm, since you had thrown the blanket to the foot of the bed, taken of your night clothes, and you were sleeping in just your underwear. "Fire...bad." You mumbled in your sleep.

'She's naked-Er, almost naked...and, I saw her, almost naked.' Nicole thought to herself nervously. "Um, Ms. Lisa...it's time to wake up...and...cover, up."

"Huh? What are you...oh my gosh," You quickly pulled the blanket over your body. "I guess I took my clothes off last night, I'm really sorry."

Nicole moved her hand from her face. "I-it's okay, I uh, don't...mind," She said as her face went even redder. "Uh, so did you...um sleep well?"

"Not really. I had a weird dream, something about fire or chili flakes or, no, it's gone."

"I'm sorry...oh! I came to ask you, um, if you wanted me to bring you some breakfast in bed."

"Thanks but I think I'd rater eat with every one else."

"Okay, I'll wait for you in the dining room, would you like me to get you a plate ready?"

"That would be nice thank you, could you get me a plate of scrambled eggs."

"Okay, it will be ready when you come down." Nicole turned around and left your room to get your breakfast ready while you got dressed.

When you opened the door to the dining room your your nose was bombarded with wonderful smells from the food that had been spread out across the table. You sat at the head of the table where your eggs had been set up.

"Oh uh, every one this is Ms. Lisa...oh! Um I hope that you like the eggs, Ms. Ilene worked very hard on them." Nicole said before gesturing to the large woman next to her.

"Not really, eggs are a simple dish to prepare, but I still hope you like them." Said the woman who would have to be Ilene.

"I'm sure I will," You took a bite out of the eggs and your eyes lit up. "These are wonderful, and they defiantly don't taste simple."

"Thank you but really it wasn't that hard, I had more trouble with Sophie's French-toast." Ilene said while pointing to the much slimmer girl who sat next to her who wore a maids uniform similar to the one that Nicole wore only it was black instead of pink.

"It's still really good though." You said before taking another bite.

Ilene smiled. "Well it's good to here that you like my cooking, after all you will be eating it a lot."

"Yeah um, it's really good, it's hard not to like anything she makes."

"Good food for every meal? Sounds great!" You said with a big smile. After that there wasn't much dialogue between you and the other girls. Once each girl finished their food they left the room soon after, except for Nicole, who waited for you to finish.

"Did you enjoy your eggs Ms. Lisa?" Nicole asked after you took the last bite out of your food.

You nodded your head. "Yes they were very good."

"Would you like anything else to eat?"

"No thank you I'm fine."

"Okay...oh! Um, Ms. Miranda has breakfast in her office which is why she wasn't here, um, you should go say hello to her...if you want."

"Alright, after I do maybe I should get to know you and the others a little better too."

Nicole's face went red again. "Oh um, okay...uh, I've got work to do...if you'd excuse me I have chores to do...sorry." Nicole then left you in the dining hall, leaving you alone.

'That was weird, why did she get so awkward, I'm sure it was nothing,' You thought to yourself while you got up and walked to the dining room door. 'I wonder if I still remember where the doctors office is?'

You find it no problem and you get to meet Miranda.

You can't find it and end up talking to a different girl before meeting Miranda.
15321.title: Shy Nicole.

choices: Bump into Sophie and talk to her for quite a while.
Talk more with Miranda, then Ilene, then even more with Miranda.
153211.content:
'I know it's around here somewhere, geez I used to have the layout of this place memorized, now I can't make heads or tails of-wait is that it," You thought when you found the door to the house doctors office. 'Finally found it!'

Behind the door was a woman with black hair and a hour glass body sitting at a desk. "Hello, you must be Lisa, my name is Miranda, it's nice to meet you." Said the woman.

'Wow, she's really hot...I really need help.' You thought to your self before you actually spoke. "It's nice to meet you too, Nicole told me you would be here and that I should come and meet you."

Miranda smiled. "Well that was sweet of her, unless she was trying to get rid of you."

You leand against a wall since there was nowhere else to sit. "No I don't think it was that, she seemed to really like me."

"Oh that's good, she can be a little shy around new people, as well as with people she already knows but not as much."

"Yeah she told me that during the conversation we had last night."

"Last night huh, what time did you get here?" Miranda said a bit worryingly.

"Around ten or ten thirty, why?" You asked curiously.

"Oh good, I was worried she might be having trouble sleeping again, but you shouldn't worry about it I've got her on some medication that's been really helping and I should be able to take her off of it soon."

"Oh...okay...that's good to know...I guess."

"Sorry, I just didn't want you to worry about her."

"No it's fine, that's very nice of you to do that. So, do you take good care of the others too?"

"Oh of course, Nicole just been having some problems recently that I've been helping her with. Truthfully though normally I don't have much to do around here most of the time, of course in my line of work that's a good thing, but it can be a bit boring sometimes."

"Do you have any hobbies to kill the time?"

"Yes, I take care of the garden and the plants around the house. I guess I'm sort of the unofficial gardener, I actually grew all the flowers in this room."

"Really? Their all so beautiful!"

"Thank you, my doctors gloves aren't the only ones with green thumbs."

"Oh I get it, that's clever."

"Thanks, I also grow some medicinal herbs for when I think that anything stronger is unnecessary, also for when I want to-no that's not a good one, it's too serious."

"What...oh! Now I get it, sorry I can be a bit slow sometimes."

"I can see that," Miranda got up from her chair and patted the seat. "Here come sit down you'll be more comfortable."

"Are you sure, what about you?"

Miranda sat down on her desk before she answered you. "I'll be fine, I've got a built in cushion, now sit."

"If you say so," You walked over to the chair and sat down in it. "So Miranda, what else do you do here, I mean you must do something other than tending to the house plants and garden."

"Well, sometimes the other girls come to me for advice for both medical and non-medical problems. Things that worry them, things they are afraid of, things about relationships and I won't get into any of that. Sometimes it makes me feel more like a head doctor than a medical one, but as long as I'm helping."

"That's a very kind thing of you to do, so speaking of relationships are you in one?"

"I used to be, but not any more, my work doesn't really leave room for me to be in a relationship."

"That's too bad, you're a very kind and...attractive woman, maybe you could take spend more time away the house when you have free time."

"That's not a solution to the problem I'm having, anyways I've got some things to take care of in the garden, sorry if you wanted to talk more."

"No it's fine...maybe,

I should go meet the other girls, but I'll talk to you later." You walk out of Miranda's office and almost immediately run into Sophie.

I could come with you, maybe I'll pick up a new hobby." You go gardening with Miranda and after you bring some fresh fruits, vegetables and herbs to Ilene.
153211.title: Like the back of my hand.

choices: You make it to the kitchen.
1532111.content:
After you and Miranda parted ways you walked the hallways looking for someone else to get better acquainted with.

You were going around a corner when you bumped into the girl that wore a pink maids uniform and accidentally knocked her over. "Geez, watch where you're going, brat!" The girl said as she pushed herself back up.

"I'm so sorry, are you okay...um, Sophie, was that your name?" You asked.

"Yeah it is, figures that you'd have to think about it." Sophie said in with a huff after she got up.

"Sorry, we haven't really gotten to know each other yet."

Sophie rolled her eyes. "Whatever, just get of my way so I can finish cleaning."

'Aw, come on cutie, don't go...I hate myself so much right now.' You thought to yourself, trying to come up with something that would get Sophie to stay. "You can take a break to get to know me."

"Humph, why would I waste my time getting to know you?"

"Maybe because we have to live together and it would be nice if we could be friends."

"And why would I want to be your friend?"

"The exact same answer as the last one."

"I don't care, if you don't bug me like you are now we won't have any problems."

"I don't want that, sharing a home with a stranger doesn't sound fun, and I'm sure that if we got to know of each other we could be good friends." You smiled. 'Or more, more is good too.'

"Listen, I haven't heard anything about you until your father died and when he did you show up from out of nowhere and take his home and business, so forgive me if I'm not quick to think that you are more than a ungrateful brat."

"The reason I didn't stay in touch with my father was because he didn't...approve, of who I am and he didn't try to contact me ether, I wasn't exactly the daughter he wanted."

"You must have been a pretty awful kid for him not to like you."

"No, I was a good kid, I did everything I was told to and was very well behaved but I did One thing that he didn't approve of and he shut me out."

"What did you do?"

"Uh...lets just say it was had something to do with who I am."

"Whatever, I guess you seem nice...but I don't know if I'm ready to call you a friend yet...tell you what, I'll give you a chance to convince me that you're worth being friends with." Sophie sat down in a bench that was underneath a window in the hallway.

"Sounds fair enough, I guess I should start by asking if you have any hobbies." You said after sitting down next to her.

"Yeah, I like to...never mind ask something else."

"You can tell me, I'm great at keeping secrets, I would give you some examples but then what kind of secret keeper would I be."

"Okay...but don't laugh, I like...to...sing. Not really though, I mostly just sing along to songs that I play in my room and I'm no good at it ether. I know all the words but I can't carry a tone."

'That seems normal, I do that too sometimes.' You thought. "Aw, how cute." Your eyes widened. 'Ah crap I mixed those two up didn't I.'

"Uh, thanks, I guess that's better than you laughing."

"Oh sorry...let me try again. Oh, that's nice, was that better?"

"It was fine."

"Good, so how are your relationships with the other girls?"

"Well my best friend here is Ilene, she's really nice but her food might have a tiny bit to do with it. Miranda is kind of like a sister to me since she's always looking out for me, and the others of course. Ruby and Nicole are nice too but they can get on my nerves when they don't get their work done, they can be so lazy sometimes and that's about it."

"That's good, I made pretty good friends with Miranda and I'm some what acquainted with Nicole."

"Wait a minute, I'm supposed to be the one asking you stuff, hmm, do you have a boyfriend? That seems like something I should know about you."

"Eh, no I don't, I haven't had one in a long time."

"Well you're pretty, I'm sure you could get one soon if you wanted."

"Thanks...you're really pretty too."

"You think so, I have to admit I haven't been in a relationship for while ether."

"See, we're bonding already."

"Yeah I guess so, alright we can be friends, but your nowhere near as close to me as Ilene...anyways I should really finish cleaning, maybe I can drop by your room later and we can get to know each other some more." Sophie said before she got up.

Your face went a little red at the thought of her in your room. "Y-yeah that...that sounds good." Sophie then walked away and soon turned a corner. 'Really nice...hmm, I wonder what time it is,' You looked around for a clock on the walls. 'What, one thirty, aw man I missed lunch. I hope I can talk to every one else before dinner, I should probably go talk to that Ilene and find out when it is so I don't miss it, I hope I don't get sidetracked, well if it's Nicole I'll make a exception.' You got up from the bench and started on your way to the kitchen.

You make it to the kitchen without running into anyone and you start to talk with Ilene.

You do run it someone, luckily it is Nicole and you start to talk with her even more.
1532111.title: Bump into Sophie and talk to her for quite a wh...

155.content:
How about we combine the original five girls with the second set. I will have to rework some of back story's but this still seems like a good choice.

Now I know it won't be original but the story set up where your father leaves you his business, mansion, fortune and staff is one of the best ways to start to start the story, but are you Norman or Lisa?
155.title: E.

1551.content:
'Ten women, I'm going to be living with ten women, this is going to be a very...interesting experience. I hope I can keep myself in check...I wonder how long I'll last before they kill me?' Those were the thoughts that went through your head as you walked up to the front door of you old home that would now become your currant one. You were dressed nicely, your hair styled in the same way you always had it, you had spent a lot of time to look good so you could make a good first impression.

When you knocked on the door it wasn't long before it opened. The girl who opened it was very thin girl with rather large breast, even for a girl of normal weight. She had brown hair, brown eyes and was wearing a maids uniform the skirt was green with white frills going around the bottom. The top was green and had sleves that went to her wrist, and had white frills around her sleeves and neck, puffed out shoulders and a white apron that went down past the skirt. "Hello, my name is Jennifer and I'm the co-head maid. You must be master Norman."

You smiled bright at Jennifer. "Yes I am but please don't call me call me master, I don't like the sound of it, so if you don't mind just call me Norman." You asked kindly.

Jennifer nodded her head. "Not at all, please come in." Jennifer steeped aside and let you enter the grand foyer.

You looked around and took in the size of this room alone. "Wow, I forgot how big this place is, I hope I remember where everything is, otherwise I'm going to end up lost in my own house."

"I'm sure you'll be fine, and if you do get lost one of us will find you eventually." Jennifer said consolingly.

"Thanks I guess, so where are the other girls, I was hoping to introduce myself before we start to go to bed."

"We just got done with dinner a hour ago so they are all probably finishing up their chores so they can have some free time before bed at ten. So you should be able to say a quick hello to all of them before then, but not if you want to have a quality conversation," Jennifer began to tap her chin. "Let me think, Ilene and Kelly should be cleaning up in the kitchen, Alex and Nicole should be in the library making sure everything is where it should be, Gracie is helping Ruby set up your office, I bet that Beth and Miranda are in the garden and Sophie is waiting for me to help set up next weeks schedule in the lounge. Who would you like to meet first?"

Choice one. You meet Ilene, Kelly, Alex and Nicole before bed. Here are the set ups.

Alex and Nicole. You enter the library from the second floor and accidentally knock some books over, scaring both of the shy girls.

Ilene and Kelly. They are fighting over who should be in charge of the Kitchen and you try to get them to stop.

Choice two. You meet Beth, Miranda and Sophie, and get to know Jennifer better. Here are the set ups.

Beth and Miranda. Nether of the girls are in the garden and you think that they might be somewhere in the greenhouse.

Jennifer and Sophie. Jennifer leads you to the lounge and after arriving you get the cold shoulder from Sophie and you try to find out why.

Choice three. You meet Gracie and Ruby and your night is filled with paper work. Here is the set up.

Gracie and Ruby. When you arrive at your new office Ruby immediately ambushes you with paper work, and Gracie...distracts you.
1551.title: Norman.

choices: You go straight to one of there rooms.
You stop at the kitchen first.
15511.content:
"*SIGH!* How dose this place get so messy, I can understand a few books scattered around, but not this many...sorry I'm complaining again." Apologized a very tall girl while she picked up books from the floor. She was wearing a similar uniform as Jennifer, only it was purple instead of green.

"It's okay, I don't like it ether," Agreed a much shorter girl in a pink version of the maids uniform that looked a little snug. "It's the only part of the original house that hasn't been changed...maybe it's haunted, that could explain how so many of the books get off their shelf."

"Nicole, there is no such thing as ghost, I'm sure that the shelves are just uneven." Replied the taller girl.

"You're right, sorry Alex." Nicole walked over to Alex and began to help pick up the books.

"You don't have to apologize, this place is a little creepy."

"Thanks, you're a really good friend. I feel like you're the only one I can be me around."

"I get that, I know we can both be really shy with the others, it's because we understand each other that we make such good friends."

"Yeah, I wish I could be as open with the others as I am with you, but I get nervous when talk to them. I was good with Mr. Harold, but that was-never mind...oh! So...do you think his son is going to be nice?"

"I'm sure he is, are you feeling nervous again?"

"Yeah sorry, this whole thing is just unsettling to me."

Alex hugged Nicole. "I know this has been hard on you but you will start to feel better once you meet him."

'Finally, I found the library...and now I feel like a idiot for having to enter on the second floor, but I can't remember how to get in from the first,' You thought to yourself while you stood in front of the door to the library. 'I hope those two girls like me, it would be awkward if they don't...no no, that's selfish, if they don't want to like me they don't have to...but I hope they do.'

"Ah-ah-ahcoo! S-sorry, it's really dusty over here." Alex apologized after she let out a cute sneeze.

"*Sniff* it's okay, it's really bad over here too, I wish we didn't have to clean in here, it's so creepy sometimes." Complained Nicole.

"Sorry, I'm the only one who can reach the higher shelves, and we're only good at working with each other so I guess you're stuck with me, but on the bright side we get to spend most of the morning outside when we clean the pool."

"Yeah...sure, the pool."

"Oh right, sorry. Listen we're almost done so lets just finish up here and we can go somewhere you actually like, okay?"

"Yeah...thank you." Nicole said with sheepish smile.

'Alright I just need to get to the ladder and I can go down to the ground floor and meet the two cleaning in here...now where is it?' You began you walk around the poorly lit second floor of the library looking for the way down. You had your arms out so that you could feel around, but it back fired when you knocked some books off of a shelf.

*Thud thud thud*

"UM...H-HELLO, IS SOMEONE THERE?!" Alex yelled when she heard the noise you made.

"Oh, yeah sorry, I'll pick it up," You bent over and blindly picked up all of the books (or what looked like all the books) before you spoke again. "There, alright I'll be right down...as soon as I find that damn ladder...sorry." You looked around for a minute or so before you located the ladder and climbed down slowly.

"W-who are you?" Alex asked going back to her shy tone.

"I'm Norman, your new boss person-Er something." You said introducing yourself.

"Oh, you're Mr. Harold's son, uh, I'm Nicole and this is Ms. Alex, it's nice to meet you."

"Thanks, it's nice to meet both of you too. I thought that I would come say hello to you two first and see how the library is looking."

"We've been taking care of it for a long time, I hope you like it." Said Alex.

"You've both done a great job, I'm surprised it's still in such good condition."

"Um, thank you, Mr. Norman, it's very hard to keep it this way." Said Nicole.

"We were just putting away the last few books and then we were going to go relax for a little while before bed, you're welcome to join us if you want." Alex offered.

"I'd like that, if you don't mind."

Choices.

You follow Alex and Nicole up to one of there bedroom's where you get to know them better.

They ask if they can make a quick pit stop at the kitchen to grab a snack, and you meet Ilene and Kelly before heading to Nicole's bed room.
15511.title: Choice one.

155111.content:
"So...this is your room?" You asked once you entered Nicole's room.

Nicole quickly nodded her head."Um, yeah, why is there something wrong with it?" She said before sitting down on her bed.

"No no, of course not, I'm just not used to this much...pink." It was true, nearly every item in Nicole's room was pink.

"Oh sorry, it's my favorite color, but I guess it is a bit much."

"No no, it's fine, my old room here was all my favorite color too, it's just well, guys normally aren't too big on pink."

"This much pink is a bit much for me too, but you get used to it after a little while." Alex said before sitting down next to Nicole.

"Sorry, but I like pink, it makes me feel more colorful than I am." Nicole said with a frown.

"Aw, Nicole not again," Alex wrapped her arms around Nicole and held her tight. "You're beautiful just way you are, it doesn't matter what color your hair or eyes or skin is."

"I hope you don't mind me saying but, you do look very...attractive, the way you are, more than you would otherwise."

"R-really? That's so nice to hear," Nicole shifted her gaze from you to Alex. "Sorry, I know you're always telling me that but um, it means more coming from a guy, especially a han-never mind."

Alex let go of Nicole and gave her a pat on the back. "It's okay, I know what you mean."

"Okay um, anyways Mr. Norman, why don't you tell us about yourself, uh, if you don't mind." Nicole asked as her cheeks went a little red.

"Not at all. Hmm, I'm trying to think of a way to talk about myself without sounding narcissistic. Well I guess I should start with that I'm a good guy, I'm trust worthy, I don't like to see people who are in pain or are upset and I would never say anything to hurt someone...I guess that makes what I said about how pretty Nicole is a little less meaningful but I did mean it," After your said what you did you took in your exact words. 'How pretty Nicole is, so stupid, she's going to think I'm coming onto her,' You looked at Nicole and gauged her reaction to what you said and she seemed unfazed. 'Phew, she doesn't look like she cares...is that a good or a bad thing? Whatever just say something before you kill the moment with silence!' "Oh sorry, I drifted of there didn't I? Anyways I don't really like secrets but if a friend asks me to keep one I will, as long as I'm not hurting anyone else by keeping it, so if you ever want to talk you can trust me."

"That's really nice Mr. Norman but, that's more about what you do for other people, not about you, I meant like what you do for fun or uh...if we can be expecting to see a girlfriend around here." Nicole said blushing even more than before.

"Oh, umm, I don't really do anything spacial for fun, and as for a girlfriend, I haven't dated in a long time."

Alex tilted her head in confusion. "Huh, why not?"

You lowered your head and stared at the floor. "I...don't like to talk about it...it's really personal." You said solemnly.

"Oh...I'm sorry, I shouldn't have asked." Alex apologized.

"No no, don't be sorry you didn't know," You said changing your tone from depressed to sincere. "I hate to make someone feel bad, so please don't, I'm sorry."

"Okay, sorry I made you feel that way." Alex apologized again.

"We're a apologetic people aren't we...wait what time is it?"

"Um...nine forty five, wow we've been talking to a while." Alex said after glancing at a clock.

"Really, aw man, I was hoping to get to know at least two of the other girls before they started to head off to bed, but don't get me wrong I really enjoyed the short time we spent together and I hope I get to know you two better another time, but I'll leave you to get ready for bed, I'll see you both in the morning though, right?"

"Mmm hmm, I'll be the one waking you up in the morning." Nicole said blushing again.

You said goodnight to both Nicole and Alex before walking out into the hallway, but it wasn't long before Nicole came after you.

"Um, Mr. Norman, can you wait a moment?" Asked Nicole soon after you left her room.

"Sure, what's the matter?" You asked back.

"Um, you're...uh, going the wrong way, your room is that way." Nicole said pointing in the opposite detection you were walking.

"Really? Man I'm really turned around, would you mind showing me where it is?"

"Of course not, follow me." Nicole turned around and started to walk in the detection she pointed to and you followed.

Nicole eventually stopped in front of a door and opened it to let you in. "Uh Nicole, I think you got turned around too, this is my fathers room-Er, his old room."

"Sorry but no, you will be staying in the master bed room."

"Seriously, it's going to be a little weird sleeping in the same room that a dead guy used to, don't you think?"

"Um, I guess so, I...I never really thought about it."

"Well, it shouldn't be to bad, I could get used to it...hopefully."

"I'm *sniff* sure you will."

You turned around and saw Nicole on the verge of tears. "What's the matter, did I say something?"

Nicole wiped her eyes with her sleeve. "No *sniff*, it's just being in this room, it reminds me of him."

"You really miss him huh."

"Yeah, every one here dose, he meant a lot to all of us. He was like a father to all of us, I know that's kind of stupid to say to you of all people, sorry."

"No no, I understand, if you lose someone you love it hurts every bit as much no matter how you are related to them, and it's good to miss someone when they're gone, but not to spend the rest of your life mourning theirs."

"*Sniff*, thanks, that makes me feel better...I should go, I don't want to bug you any more than I already have."

"You don't have to, if you want to talk some more just sit down and start." You sat down on the bed and gave it a pat as to invite Nicole to sit with you.

"Um, if you don't mind." Nicole said before sitting down.

"Would I have said anything if I did?"

"I guess not."

"So what's on your mind?"

"Well, I didn't want to say anything but, I was nervous about meeting you, that you might not like me."

Well that's just stupid."

"W-what?"

"I could probably have worded that better but Nicole, you're a great girl, there is absolutely no reason for me not to like you. You're so kind and beautiful any one would be lucky to have you as a friend."

"B-beautiful? Do you really think I look beautiful?"

'Ah crap she caught it that time, it's okay just come up with something quick.' "Um, of course..." 'Damn it!"

"Th-thank you...um, you look...nice, too. Sorry, that wasn't a very good complement, was it."

You and Nicole continued to talk for quite some time before,

Alex came looking for Nicole.

You and Nicole fall asleep in your bed.
155111.title: You go straight to one of there rooms.

1551112.content:
Nicole rolled over in bed after her internal clock woke her, but was still too tiered to open her eyes, let alone get up. 'Mmmm, I stayed up way too late with Mr. Norman last night. I wish I could sleep a little longer but if I don't get Mr. Norman out of bed soon Ms. Sophie will get mad at me,' Nicole sat up in bed and wiped the sleep out of her eyes. When she opened her eyes she saw that she was still in your room, in your bed, next to you. 'Oh no! D-did we...sleep together? No I'm probably worrying about nothing, but I still need to find out.' Nicole put a hand on your shoulder and tried to gently wake you.

"Hmm, wh-whats going on," You asked still half asleep. When you finally opened your eyes and saw Nicole under the same blanket you quickly got out of your bed. "D-did we sleep together, I mean, we obviously did in the normal way but, did we do it in the way where there's not much sleeping?"

"Um, I don't know, do you think we um, did, in that way?"

"Well, we both still have our clothes on and nether of us remember, so unless we decided to put our clothes back on and completely forget about it, I think we're safe."

"Yeah, you're right, I guess I was too panicked to really think about it."

"Good, I was worried for a minute, I'm relieved we didn't."

"Oh...I'm sorry I had you so worried."

"No no, it's not you, you are a very beautiful girl, very sweet girl and I'm sorry if I made it sound like you were not."

Nicole's pale cheeks went red and a sheepish smile came to her face. "Thank you, it's always nice to hear that from you."

"Sorry, it's just I've never had very good luck when it comes to women. N-not that sleeping with you would be a bad thing I just don't want to ruin our friendship and not because we couldn't be more than that I just-"

"I-it's okay, I get what you're trying to say...oh! Um, I think we should get ready for breakfast, before the others wake up and start to wonder where we are, especially Gracie. She can make wild assumptions about this kind of thing."

"Yeah, this was hard to explain to ourselves, let alone the rest of the house."

After that Nicole left your room so that you could both change into some fresh clothes but soon met up again to get on with the day. You and Nicole walked down the main starecase and into the kitchen, where two women who wore chef outfits were arguing.

"No she'll hate that, trust me, she is my best friend after all." Said the much larger of the two.

"Well I think she'll love it, trust me, I am the better chef after all." Said the one who was more or less the same size as Nicole.

"No way, I'm the better chef!"

"Uh, are we interrupting something?" You asked.

"YES," They yelled at the same time before turning to face you. "Wait, who are you?" They asked speaking in unison again.

"Um, Kelly, Ilene, this is Mr. Norman, the late masters son." Nicole said from behind you.

"Oh...well, sorry you had to see that...anyways, what would you like for breakfast?" Asked the thiner one.

"How about some waffles, as long as you don't get in a fight over it."

"I think we can handle it, right Kelly?" Asked the larger one, who would have to be Ilene.

"Right, they will be the best waffles you've ever had," Kelly said before guiding you and Nicole into the dining room. "Now leave us alone, we don't cook well while we are being watched!" Kelly then walked back into the kitchen.

"Are they always like this?" You asked while you walked over to the table and sat down.

"When they are cooking yes, but when they're not they are really nice," Nicole said before sitting down next to you. "The other girls should be here soon, they're all really nice too, but some of them can be a handful as well."

"Sounds...interesting."

It t long before the the other girls started to arrive. The first two enter the dining room were,

Jennifer and Sophie. You say hello again to Jennifer and try to get to know the other girl but she isn't interested in you.

Alex and Gracie. Alex is being her normal shy self and Gracie is being...Gracie.
1551112.title: Choice two.

15511122.content:
It wasn't long after you and Nicole sat down that Alex came into the dining room with another girl behind her.

Alex sat down quietly across the table from you and Nicole and gave you both a sheepish smile,while the other girl rushed over to Nicole. "Hey beautiful, how are you today?"

"Um, I'm fine, Gracie." Nicole said without even looking at the girl.

"That's good. You know I stopped by your room last night and you weren't there. If you're having trouble sleeping again you could always come crawl into bed with me," Gracie then looked at you and put a hand on your shoulder. "Or is that what your friend here is for?"

"W-what?! No no of course not!" You said defensively.

"Relax, I was just kidding. Maybe you'd rather spend the night with me sometime, I wasn't the late masters favorite for nothing."

"I don't know what's weirder, that you were hitting on Nicole a minute ago, or that you just said that you were sleeping with my father."

"F-father? So you're the new master," You nodded your head. "I am so fired."

"No no, I'm not going to fire you, but I do hope that you were just kidding."

"Oh of course...maybe I should just shut up and eat," Gracie paused and looked at your eyes. "You would like to see that wouldn't you?"

"Huh, what?" You asked, feeling confused (or maybe worried).

"Don't think I can't see you eying my stomach." Gracie said before giving her stomach a pat.

"What, no I wasn't."

Gracie sat down next to you and smiled. "Hey it's okay, you like 'em big, that's just good news for me."

"Th-that's crazy, I don't have a size preference for women." You lied.

"So you do like big women, just not more than thinner women."

"I...guess so, but the body isn't the only thing, the personality is important too. Take Nicole and Alex for instance, they both have great personalities...not that you aren't pretty too I was just trying to say that your personalities are just as great...and I'm not trying to come onto you or anything I was-"

"Is he always so nervous?" Gracie asked, interrupting you.

"N-not all the time but...yeah." Nicole replied.

"Fun!" Gracie said with a smile.

"This...this has been a weird morning...sorry." Alex said finally joining the conversation.

"I...have to agree with Alex. Maybe we should change the subject." You offered.

"Yeah...um...oh! Gracie you don't know even know Mr. Norman's name...and now you do, sorry." Nicole apologized.

"Norman? That's a boring name, it's so...plain. I know, I'll give you a nick name."

"Uh, that's okay, I'm fine with the normal name I have now."

"Hmm, normal...Norman...hmm."

"No!"

"Fine, fine. You don't have to get angry."

"I don't know, I kind of like normal, it's kinda c-Er never mind." Nicole said blushing a little bit.

"Aw, Nicole's face is going red, I think she likes you!" Gracie teased.

"Um, yeah I do but uh, not like that. He is just a friend."

"Yeah I like him that way too." Alex added.

"Wow, getting friend zoned by two girls at the same time, that's gotta hurt."

"I only met them yesterday so not really."

"Ding ding ding, breakfast is ready," Ilene said as she and Kelly brought trays of food. "Hey, where is every one else?"

"The smell of your cooking must have scared them away." Kelly said as she put two trays down on the table.

From what you saw earlier you knew that you should steep in before Ilene and Kelly start to go at it again. "I think they might just be sleeping in."

"So we made all this food, and there's not enough people to eat it all." Ilene said after setting two more trays down.

Nicole's face went red again. "Um, I could eat a little extra, if that would help."

"I know some one who would like to see that."

"Is it okay if I eat somewhere else, please?" You asked only half joking.

"No, you are going to eat here like every one else...almost, every one else." Kelly said before sitting down.

"Can we at least eat quietly?"

"Fine by me, mouths are for eating at meal time any way." Ilene said as she sat down too.

After breakfast you want to meet the other girls, but who do you bring with you?

You want to take Nicole, but she ate too much and can't get up yet so you stay with her until she can.

Nicole is fine and you've bugged enough for today so you take either Alex or Gracie or both of them with you.
15511122.title: ...Gracie.

155111222.content:
"Ugh, I ate way too much." You moaned after leaving the dining room.

"Why are you complaining, you only ate your food, and you didn't even finish it all." Gracie said, following close behind you.

"It was still more than I normally eat."

"Quit whining, Nicole ate way more than you did, and she barely eats anything most of the time. Poor girl is going to starve herself if she keeps eating the way she is."

“She looked well fed to m-” You stopped walking and froze in the middle of the hallway when your sentence was cut short by Gracie slapping you across the face.

“Oh my gosh, I’m so sorry, It was a reflex I didn’t mean to.” She said quickly after hitting you.
