“No no, it’s fine I deserved that, I just meant she was eating pretty well earlier, I guess I should have said that the first time,” You said while rubbing your cheek. “So I guess you slapping me means that you’re really worried about her."

"Kinda, she dose eat, though most of the time she only nibbles on stuff, and that's cute and everything but I'd still feel better if she ate more."

"If your being serious and aren't just setting me up for some kind of feeder joke, I'll help."

"I would never use someone I'm worried about as a set up for a stupid joke."

"Alright than...I guess I could invite her to my room later on for a snack or something, after I've met every one first."

"Dose it really have to be in your room?"

"No no, I was just making a suggestion, but if you have a better place or idea than I'll do that instead."

"Just promise me that you wont try anything alright."

"I promise I wont try anything."

Gracie smiled and started to walk again. "Good, now than, how about I introduce you to the other girls, they should be up by-" Gracie was cut off when another girl in a black version of the maid uniform slammed into her and knocked the girl over.

"Geez Gracie watch where you're going," The other girl said as she picked herself up of the ground. "I've got to hurry up and eat breakfast before I fall farther behind."

"Oh...sorry Sophie but you missed breakfast, everything was eaten." Gracie apologized.

"What! I sleep in this one time and I miss my favorite meal of the day...wait a minute, who’s this?" Sophie asked, pointing at you.

"Oh I'm-"

"He's a friend of Nicole's." Gracie said cutting you off.

"A friend of Nicole's huh, how come I've never met him before?"

"Actually I'm-"

"He lives kinda far away, but he's going to be in town for a few weeks so Nicole invited him to stay here."

"Well, as long as he doesn’t mess up the house I guess it's okay. Anyways, since there's no breakfast for me to eat I guess I should get to work." Sophie said before walking away.

"Um, mind telling me what that was about?" You asked after Sophie was gone.

"Trust me, wait until she knows you better before you tell her who you are, because doing that know would be a mistake."

"Let's pretend I understand why, won't she notice that I live her now!"

"You only have to pretend you're not you until she likes you, then she should have no problem with."

"I...I'm just going to to go with this for now."

"Good, now how about we go meet every one already."

"Sounds good to me, do you have a idea on who to start with?"

"Actually I do, I thought we could kill two birds with one stone by stopping by the garden," After that Gracie took you by the hand and lead you outside. Once you were in the garden Gracie walked you over to two girls in the middle of the garden, one with black hair and one with brownish blond. "Beth, Miranda, this is Norman, he's the late masters son."

"He is? I saw some pictures of him from when he was a kid around the house, and I have to say I wasn't expecting him to look like this." Said the girl with black hair.

"I know, he turned out really cute. What do you think Beth?" Gracie asked.

"I guess so..." Said the girl with the brownish blond hair.

"So Miranda, you and Beth weren't at breakfast, did you both sleep in wink wink?"

"I never have breakfast with the rest of you, and I'm not sure how Beth spends her mornings." Replied Miranda.

"Just going to ignore that last part huh?"

"What do you mean?"

"Thought so."

"I don't understand but anyways, Norman. What have you been up to since you got here?"

'My invisibility must have worn off...don't say that.' You thought to yourself before talking aloud. "I've been trying to meet every one since I got here last night."

"Oh, who have you met so far?

"Well, when I got here I talked with Jennifer for a short time, then I went to the library where I meet Alex and Nicole. After we talked for a while Nicole showed me up to her room where the three of us talked for a while before it got late and I left for my room."

"Sounds like you had a long night."

"It didn't end there. After I walked a few feet towards my old room, Nicole came after me and told me that I was going to be staying in my fathers room. Once I got there I said something stupid and upset Nicole but I fixed it, but after that we spent a long time talking, And This morning I meet Ilene, Kelly, Gracie and Sophie."

"So Nicole was up pretty late with you huh, do you remember what time she left?"

"Uh, I...um, fell asleep before she left and I don't remember the time, why?"

"Poor Nicole's been having trouble sleeping, I offered her to come sleep with me but she always says no." Gracie said, sounding upset.

"Do you want me to help her with that, too?"

"You promised that you weren't going to try anything!"

"No no, I wasn't trying anything, I just thought I could try and help her with that later on while were having that snack."

"What are you two talking about?" Miranda Asked

"I was going-"

"Norman here has taking a shining to Nicole and he invited her to come up to his room later, but I made him promise that he wouldn't try anything." Gracie said Interrupting you again.

"Is this like the thing with-"

"Kinda...that reminds me, if you two see Sophie or Ruby, Norman is a friend of Nicole's from out of town, okay?"

"Um, alright. Anyways I should get back to my office, but feel free to stop by any time you like."

"Well, I've still got to introduce Nicole's friend to Ruby before lunch, so we better get moving too." After that Gracie too you by the hand again and led you back into the house.

When you met Ruby it was pretty much the same as with Sophie, only Gracie did most of the talking, and you barely ever heard Ruby say two words. The rest of the day was uneventful, but know it was almost over and you still had a promise to keep and after a quick trip for snacks you were ready for Nicole to come to your room.

'Alright, Nicole should be here any minute, all I have to do is get her to have a little snack and then make sure she gets to bed on time.' You thought to yourself while you waited for Nicole to enter your room, and you didn't have to wait long before,

Nicole arrives and you offer her something to eat while you talk. When Nicole finishes the snacks it isn't long before she starts to fall asleep, in your bed, with you, again.

Sophie comes in to clean and is confused as to why you are in the late masters bedroom. When Sophie starts asking questions you start feel bad for lying to her and come clean and apologize, and when Nicole arrives you invite Sophie to stay for snack time.
155111222.title: Gracie the tour guide.

1551112222.content:
Your bedroom door opened and Sophie walked in. "Hey you're Nicole's friend right, what are you doing in here?" She asked with a angry tone before closing the door behind her.

your eyes darted back and forth as you tried to come up with a excuse. "I..., I'm lost."

"*Sigh*, it is a big house," Luckily you were able to hide the snacks before Sophie spotted them. "Whatever, just go I've got to clean in here, some stupid kid was supposed to be here yesterday but he didn't show, but some how his bed got messed up and now I have to make it again."

"Oh, sorry."

"Why are you sorry, did you do this?!" Sophie half asked half yelled.

"No no, I'm just sorry that you have to do that."

"Thanks, I guess," Sophie said as she started to make your bed. "So, how do you know Nicole?"

"Um...I met her a little while ago the last time I was in town, and we uh...just hit it off I guess." 'At least that's kind of true...'

"Okay...so are you two dating or something?" Sophie asked as she finished making your bed.

"No no, we're just friend's."

"Geez, calm down I was just asking."

"Sorry, I can get worked up over the smallest things some times."

"Whatever...so are you single or, what?"

"Uh, single...why?"

"Well, you're just a good looking guy and I was just wondering."

"Thanks...so...that stupid kid...who is he?"

"He's the son of the man who used to own this house, now that brat kid dose."

"How do you know he's a brat."

"I his father told me about him, and that's what I heard, that he's some spoiled brat, you know he wasn't even at his own fathers funeral."

"Maybe there was some complex reason behind that. I'm sure he's a nice guy, like me."

"I wish he could be like like you, you're so nice you're defending him even though you don't know him."

"I wouldn't say that."

"What do you mean?"

"*Sigh*, I'm sorry, I feel like I'm throwing Gracie under the bus but I can't keep lying, I'm not a friend of Nicole's, I'm Norman."

"Norman is the name of...You're...you son of a-"

"Please forgive me, Gracie said that I should wait until you got to know me before I told you who I am."

"Don't blame poor Gracie you jerk!"

"I'm not trying to blame her but it's true."

"Yeah right, and what kind of creep are you to pretend to be Nicole's friend for some weird reason."

"I wasn't pretending to be her friend I really am, I was just pretending that I knew her before last night."

*Knock knock knock* "Mr. Norman I'm here, are you in there?" Nicole asked from the other side of the door.

"You invited her to your room you sicko!"

"Sorry Nicole but don't come in yet," You yelled at the door before turning back to Sophie. "It's not what you think, Gracie was worried about how little Nicole's been eating and sleeping so I offed to talk to her and have a little snack with her."

"R-Really?"

"Yes, and if you don't believe me you can stay and make sure I don't try anything, even though I already promised Gracie I wouldn't."

"Fine...but only because I want to make sure you treat Nicole right, got it?"

"Thank you," You then turned away from the Sophie and opened your door. "Sorry about that Nicole."

"It's okay, I don't mind waiting...for you," Nicole walked into your room buty froze when she saw Sophie. "Oh...um, you shouldn't be in here. This is late ,asters room. Sorry Sophie I wont lose sight of him again."

"Relax Nicole, I told her."

"Phew, I'm sorry for lying to you Sophie. You know I don't like to lie to people, right?" Nicole asked.

"Of course I do. So than how did he convince you to lie?" Sophie asked back.

"H-He didn't. Gracie told me to say that he was my friend from out of town."

"Alright than, now that that's settled how about some snacks?"

Nicole sat down on your bed and nodded her head. "Um, Okay, goodbye Sophie."

"Oh I'm staying." Sophie said before sitting down next to Nicole.

"Oh...I thought it was just going to be me and Mr. Norman."

"He would like that wouldn't he."

"He, is standing right here...anyways, do you want something sweet or salty?"

"Um...what kind of stuff do you have?"

"I have plain or spicy chips for salty, and some chocolate covered caramels for sweet, sorry I don't have a wide array of snacks."

"Um...could I have some of those chocolate thingy's?"

"You can have all of them if you want," You said before handing the bag to Nicole. "And what do you want Sophie?"

Sophie took a bag of chips from you and opened them. "I'll have some of these," Sophie reached into the bag and pulled out a single chip and tossed it in her mouth. "Hot, hot, hot!" Sophie let go of the bag and used her hand's to fan her mouth.

"Nicole give her some of the chocolate's, the milk in them should help."

Nicole opened the bag and gave some of the candy's to Sophie. She quickly tossed them into her mouth and a look of relief came to her face. "*Sigh*, thank you so much, Nicole."

You bent over and picked the bag up from the floor. "I must have grabbed the really spicy kind by mistake, tell you what, these can be mine and you can have the plain kind."

"There is no way you can eat those."

"Uh...then I just wont have anything."

"So, Mr. Norman, what did you want to talk to me about, did I do something wrong?" Nicole asked.

"No no, it's nothing like that. I hoping that we could just talk, like we did last night."

"Last night. What was she doing talking to you last night?'" Sophie asked.

"Well, me, Nicole and Alex were-"

"Alex was there, never mind then."

"Um, Sophie...you don't really seem to like Mr. Norman, so why are you here?"

"Because I don't trust him alone with you."

"So you don't like him but, you should, he's really nice and, um..." Nicole's eyes started to open and shut. "Um...Um, sorry."

"Nicole, are you okay?" You asked.

Nicole opened her eyes again and kept them open. "Um, Yeah...I've been kind of tierd all day...I didn't sleep to well last night."

"Oh...sorry."

"Why are you sorry, did you keep her up all night or something?" Sophie asked angrily.

"No no, I'm just sorry she didn't sleep well."

"Whatever, so Nicole do you want to go to your room so that you can get some rest?"

"Um...no I...no..." Nicole's eyes closed again but this time she kept them closed.

Sophie stood up from your bed, put her hand on Sophie's shoulder and shook her slightly. "Nicole? Nicole!"

"Leave her alone, she's tiered." You got up and slowly laid Nicole down on your bed.

"No way, I'm not leaving you alone with her!"

"And I'm not moving her, she feel asleep at a good time which is what I promised Gracie. I also promised her that I wouldn't try anything, and bedside's, look at her, she's sleeping so peacefully."

"Fine, but if she stay's, I stay too."

"That's okay with me, so, do yo u have a sleeping bag or-"

"I'm sleeping next to her, I don't want anything to happen to her while I sleep." Sophie said as she walked over too the other side of your bed and then lied down.

"Alright, I guess I'll just sleep on the floor." You then grabbed a extra pillow and blanket out of your bedroom closet and set yourself up on the floor and went to sleep.

You and Sophie had no trouble getting a good night's rest, but did Nicole?

Nicole's internal clock tells her to wake up early again, and when she sees Sophie sleeping next to her she freaks out.

Nicole sleeps well into the afternoon and wakes up well rested, but worried she's making a habit out of sleeping in your bed.
1551112222.title: Snack time for two.

choices: You made it on time for breakfast.
You, Nicole, Gracie and Jennifer were to late for breakfast.
15511122221.content:
'Mmmm, I haven't slept this well in a long time. I actually feel well rested...I wonder what's different? Think, did I go to sleep early? No, at least I don't think I did...My bed dose feel a little different. Maybe I'm...sleeping...in it...differently...it happened again, didn't it?' Nicole opened her eyes and saw Sophie sleeping right next to her. "Eeep!" Out of shock Nicole rolled out if your bed and fell onto the floor with a thud.

"Huh, Nicole what's wrong...Nicole?" Sophie said as she jerked up in our bed. Sophie looked around but didn't see Nicole. Then she looked at you, still sleeping on the floor, and threw a pillow at you head.

"What, what's going on?"

"Don't act like you don’t know you creep, what did you do with Nicole?!"

"Um...Sophie...I'm down here."

Sophie leaned over and looked at the floor and saw Nicole laying on there. "Nicole, what happened?"

"You don't know either?" Nicole asked as she picked herself up off of the floor.

"What are you talking about?" Sophie asked back.

"I mean...did we-"

"Nicole." You interrupt.

"Huh?"

"Clothes are on."

"What...oh! Right...sorry."

"Clothes are on? You make it sound like this has happened before."

"..."

"..."

"Wait...you son of a-"

"Sophie!"

"You slept with her!"

"Sort of but-"

"You pervert, I'll kill you!" Sophie shouted as she shot up out of your bed.

"Sophie please don't."

"Listen to Nicole, please listen to Nicole."

"Why should I?"

"Because I really like him...I mean...h-he's a good friend, he would never do that to me. O-Or any one else. We just fell asleep at the same time."

"If that's really all that happened than fine," Sophie said before walking to your bedroom door. "I'm going to go down stairs, I don't want to miss breakfast two days in a row. I don't even know how I made it One day without French-toast."

"Thanks for sticking up for me, Nicole." You said after Sophie left.

"Um, you're welcome, I'm sure that you would have done the same." Nicole said blushing a bit.

"I don't think you would ever end up on the opposite end of this situation. You're too sweet to ever do anything wrong."

"Th-thanks...you, too." Nicole said as her face went even redder.

"I mean it, you're a really nice girl."

"And you're a really nice guy...oh! Um, we should get down stairs, before we miss breakfast."

"Yeah, and we don't want Gracie getting any ideas either."

"I guess...well, lets go." Nicole said before you both walked out of your room.

You and Nicole made it half way down the hall before Gracie spotted you and walked after you. "Hey beautiful! How did you sleep?" She asked once she caught up to both of you.

"Oh...hi Gracie," Nicole said not even bothering to stop walking or to even look at Gracie. "I slept pretty well actually."

"Yeah, I bet that bed in the master bedroom is comfy."

Nicole stopped walking and faced Gracie. "W-What do you mean?" She asked innocently.

"I stopped by your room again last night, and again you weren't there. So I thought you must still be up with Norman and I went to his room to tell him off for keeping you up so late, but when I got there you were asleep in his bed with Sophie, and he sleeping on the floor. Now while I'm happy that you were getting good sleep And Norman was respecting you, I am a little jealous that Sophie got to share a bed with you. Which reminds me," Gracie said before giving you a kiss on the cheek. "Thank you."

"Gracie!" You yelled at the same time as Nicole.

"Don't be jealous, Nicole. I was just thanking him the only way I know how." Gracie said with a shrug of her shoulders.

"I'm not...I don't...*Sigh*, okay." Nicole said before starting to walk again.

You hadn't made it even a whole five feet before a door went flying open, hitting you in the face and knocking you over.

It was Jennifer who had accidentally knocked you onto your back, and while she wasn't quick to figure out what happened, she Was quick to make sure you were okay once she did. She had dropped down to her knees and was hunched over you, her disproportionally large breast pressed against your chest. "I am so sorry, are you okay?" She apologized with a very worried tone.

"Um, I-I think so..." You replied after the stars faded away.

"Wait, I think...y-your nose is bleeding!"

"Do you want Gracie to kiss your booboo and make it all better?" Gracie asked with a cutesy tone.

"Gracie! Don't make jokes he's hurt!" Nicole said worryingly.

Jennifer got off of her knees and began to help you up. "I think we should get him to Miranda, he might have a broken nose!” Accompanied by Gracie and Nicole, Jennifer slowly escorted you down stairs and into the house doctor's office.

"Whoa, what happened to you?" Miranda asked as Jennifer sat you down in a chair.

"I walked into a door."

"Now, now, you don't need to lie to me, is he hitting you again?" Miranda joked as she began to examine your nose.

"Not. Funny."

"Well, your nose is only bruised, and so is your funny bone," Miranda then put her hand into her coat pocket and after fishing around in it she pulled a bandage out of it. "This will keep you nasal passages open so it can heal properly."

"Why do you just have this on you?" You asked as Miranda applied the bandage.

"Just be happy that I did, I don't have any of these anywhere else. So consider yourself lucky...there, all patched up. Just keep that on and your nose will be better in about two weeks."

"So he's okay?" Nicole asked.

"Hmm, now that I think about it he might have some head trauma as well," Miranda said before she started to examine your head. "Yup, you've got a pretty big bump there. I'm going to have to ask that one of you look after him for the day to make sure he's really okay."

"I'll do it, this is my fault after all." Jennifer offered.

"No no, it's not your fault. I was just in the wrong place at the wrong time. Besides, I'm a grown man, I can look after myself."

"Let's hear you say that when you slip into a coma."

"If I'm in a coma I wouldn't be able to say anything."

"Exactly, now Jennifer, I want you to come to me if starts feeling drowsy. Oh, and as for your nose Norman, no lying on your face, no sports, and no kissing."

"I wasn't really planing on doing any of that, so..."

"And no picking it!"

"What am I, five?"

"Anyways, you should hurry up and get to breakfast before you miss it."

"Will you be joining us today?" Jennifer asked.

"No, I've been wanting to read up on some boring medical stuff that probably don't care about, and I wanted to show Beth...some thing in the garden that you probably don't care about either."

"You sure have been spending a lot of time with Beth lately, I'm starting to think something is going on between you two." Gracie said with a suggestive tone.

"And if I get hungry I can always have a few fresh strawberry’s."

"Ignoring me again, huh?"

"Hmm, what was that?"

"I should be used to this by now...*Sigh*."

"Alright, the doctors office is closed, come back later." Miranda said as she showed you all out, closing the door behind you.

"Well, I don't know about you three, but I'm going to get some breakfast before it's too late." Gracie said as she turned to leave for the dinning room."

"Yeah...I'm a little hungry, too. See you soon..." Nicole said before following Gracie.

"Man, this has been a eventful morning." You complained.

"Again I'm really sorry." Jennifer apologized.

"No no, I wasn't talking about you, just this whole morning in general."

"Uh, okay...hmm."

"What is it?"

"It's nothing just, weren't you wearing that yesterday?"

"Oh, yeah I guess so...guess that means Nicole is, too...and probably Sophie."

"Why would they-"

"It would be easier if you don't ask, it's not that important."

"Okay...I guess we should go have breakfast now."

"Right...you're going to need to show me."

"Did I really hit you that hard?"

"No no, I'm just quiet used to being back in this house yet."

"Okay then, just follow me." Jennifer took your hand and lead you through the hallway to the dining room, but when you got there,

You made it on time for breakfast, but the whole time both Sophie and Ruby looked at you funny.

You, Nicole, Gracie and Jennifer were to late for breakfast, and would have to wait until launch to eat.
15511122221.title: Quest complete! Reward: A kiss...and a bloody nose

155111222212.content:
(A/N. I made this too long so I had to make it into two parts, which means only one choice at the end. Sorry about that.)

The dinning room was empty except for Sophie, who was sitting there humming while she ate. "Well it looks like I made you all miss breakfast, sorry about that." You apologized.

"I-It's okay, I wasn't very hungry anyways, and I did have a big breakfast yesterday to...help but...it wasn't worth it." Nicole said with a hand on her stomach.

Jennifer lowered her head. "This is my fault, if I hadn't run poor Norman over with my door..."

"Geez, it was one meal but you talk about it as if it were your last." Gracie joked.

"Well, not for Jennifer," You said before turning to Jennifer. "How about I take you out to dinner tonight."

"W-Why her, I mean, why just her?" Nicole asked.

"Well, she did miss breakfast twice, and I am making her feel bad for doing this to me," You said pointing your nose. "Even though it was as much my fault as hers. So how about I take you out, anywhere you want tonight, okay?"

"Th-This is really out of nowhere but, okay. If it will make you feel better, but only if I pay for your food."

"Fine by me, as long as I pay for yours."

Gracie started to giggle to herself. "Kiss, kiss, kiss!" She chanted from the sidelines of your conversation.

"G-Gracie!" You, Nicole and Jennifer shouted at the same time.

"Oh that's right, he can't."

"Let me say this now, this is not a date, just a apology." You stated plainly.

Jennifer nodded her head in agreement. "Right, I feel the same way."

"Um...I'm going to go find Alex...we need to get to work." Nicole said before leaving the kitchen.

"So...what were you planning on doing today?" Jennifer asked.

"Wandering around mostly, although I was hoping on getting to do something productive."

"Alright, I guess I'll be tagging along, I need to keep a eye on you after all, but if I start bugging you tell me and I can just check in on you every now and then."

"No no, you'll be fine. Now let's go." This time it was you who took someone by the hand and lead them off somewhere.

"So...Sophie..." Gracie said once she and Sophie were alone.

While you were leading Jennifer around looking for someone to talk to. Nicole had found Alex, and was insistent that they get to work.

"R-Really? You've never been in a hurry to clean the pool before, is something wrong?" Alex asked sounding concerned.

Nicole shook her head back and forth. "No...it's nothing. Lets just get to work..."

"You're my best friend Nicole, I can always tell when you are upset, and you are."

Nicole tried to put on a fake smile, but still looked upset. "I said it's nothing...I'd be stupid to think anything else."

"Right, because that's going to convince me."

"I'm sorry, I'm just...stupid."

"No you're not! Why would you say something like that?"

"Because it's true! I...I should have known."

"Known what?"

"That he wouldn't like me, they...they never like me..."

"Nicole..."

Meanwhile, you had finally found someone to talk to. It was the busty maid with a British accent, Ruby.

"Oh, hello there Mr. Nicole's friend. How are you enjoying your stay here?"

'So either Sophie didn't tell her, or she hasn't gotten a chance to.' You thought to yourself before speaking any actual words. "Oh, you have a British accent." You said stating the obvious.

"Yes and you have a American accent, and the sky is blue and water is wet, isn't the world full of surprises." Even when she was being sarcastic Ruby's voice made her sound polite.

"Sorry, I just didn't notice. When I first spoke to you I only heard you say two words since Gracie was doing most of the talking."

"Yeah, she'll do that. So...what-uh...what happened to your nose?"

"Uh, you had to be there."

"Okay, whatever that means. Oi, Jen, you're being really quiet, what's up?"

Jennifer snapped out of her daze and looked at Ruby. "Hmm? Oh, nothing, I'm just thinking about something."

"Speak up girl, no point in you just standing there."

"It's nothing, really, don't mind me."

"If you're not going to contribute to the conversation then why are you here?"

"Well, when 'Mr. Nicole's friend' hurt his nose he also hit his head, so I'm keeping an eye on him to make sure he's okay."

"Shouldn't Nicole be doing that? He's her mate after all."

"M-Mate?! I'm not her mate, we're just friends!"

"Yeah, that's what it means, idiot!"

"Oh...sorry, yeah I think I've...I've...heard that before-do you hear that?"

"Hear what?"

"It sounds like...crying?"
155111222212.title: Nicole's tears.

1551112222121.content:
"*Sniff*, I'm sorry, I just really like him." Nicole apologized between quiet sobs.

"Nicole, you've known him for three days. It's just a little crush, you'll get over it eventually."

"But...but, *Sniff*, I don't want to!" Nicole said before breaking down crying.

"Yup, that's defiantly crying! I'm sorry Ruby we'll have to pick this up later!" You said before taking off ruining.

"Huh? What's going on...where did Norman go?" Asked Jennifer once she snapped back to reality again.

"Where do you go when you do that?" Ruby said before walking after you.

Alex sat Nicole down and began to rub her back to console her. "Is there anything I can do?"

"*Sniff*, no, I just want to be sad for a little while."

"Where is it coming from?" You shouted as you tried to find the source of the crying.

"Who was that?" Alex asked.

"In here!" You yelled as you came running in to the room.

Nicole's eyes went wide when she saw you. "N-Norman! What are you-"

"I heard you crying! Are you okay? Are you hurt, is there something I can do?"

"I-I'm fine," Nicole said as she wiped the tears from her eyes. "What are you-"

"Seriously?! Someone was actually crying, how did you hear her we were on the other side of the house?!" Ruby said when see came into the room and saw Nicole's pale cheeks were red from all her crying.

"The other side of the planet isn’t far enough to keep me from knowing when someone I care about is sad! Now Nicole, what's wrong?"

"Some one you care about? So you-" Nicole smiled again but this time it was genuine. "Nothing, not any more."

"Nope, that's not going to work, and I'm not leaving you until you tell me what's wrong!"

"I...I can't say, it’s embarrassing." Nicole said as her cheeks went red.

"This may sound rude but, I don't care, you're my friend and I can't just leave you when you're sad! So the sooner you tell me the sooner I can help!"

"No I can't...you...I can't tell you."

"Yes you can, you can tell me-"

"Are you seriously this dense? She can't tell you because it's about you! She obviously likes you!"

"Ruby!" Nicole yelled.

"...No that can't be it."

"No, Ruby's right. Nicole has had a crush on you since she first met you."

"Alex!"

"Is that true Nicole?"

Nicole's cheeks went even redder. "Y-Yes...it i-"

"I am so sorry." You apologized.

"Why are you sorry?" Nicole asked worryingly. 'Does that mean he doesn't like me back?!"

"It must have hurt you to see me ask Jennifer to dinner. That's why you are upset, isn’t it?"

"I'm sorry."

"Don't be. It's my fault, I never thought you would like me back. So I didn't think me asking Jennifer to a apology dinner would hurt you."

"Did...did you say you like me back?"

"Come on Alex, let's leave these two alone. You too Je-where the hell did she go? She is always doing this, that little scatterbrain." Ruby said as she stormed out of the room, Alex followed and closed the door behind her.

Nicole stood up when the others were gone and her cheeks went so red it seemed imposable for them to grow any redder. "S-So, do you really like me back?"

You smiled and laughed a little bit. "Sorry, I know shouldn't be laughing but, you were right, this is embarrassing."

Nicole sunk her head down "S-So you don't..."

"No no, Er-I mean...Yes, I do. I guess I should have told you, but I was worried I might mess things up between us."

"I...you...*Sniff*," Nicole's eyes began to water again. "I'm sorry, I'm just so-"

"Ah! Please don't start crying again, I'm sorry!"

"Let me finish, please," Nicole wiped her eyes and smiled again. "These are happy tears, I'm just so happy to hear that!"

"Heh, and I'm happy to see you smile."

"Hehe, thank you. Um, so...should we...kiss?"

"I think you're forgetting something." You said pointing at your nose.

"Oh right, sorry."

"It's okay, how about a hug for now?"

"A hug? Um...I...okay." You held out your arms and Nicole sheepishly inched her way closer to you. When Nicole was close enough you wrapped your arms around her and pulled her close to you, while her arms dangled helplessly to her sides.

"You know a hug is normally a two person activity."

'Come on. You can do this, you hug Alex all the time. It's the same thing just...better!' Nicole thought before she slowly began to wrap her arms around you.

Once she had her arms around you she didn't stop squeezing you. "Owtch!"

Nicole's eyes went wide again as she pushed herself away from you."I'm sorry!"

"No no, it's okay. I just wasn't expecting someone as small as you to be so strong!"

'S-Small? Since when am I small? He must only be trying to be nice...I don't think I mind though.'

"I think we just need to get used to each other. Tell you what, since I'm taking Jennifer out to dinner, I'll take you out to lunch. Does that sound good?"

"I-Is this a date-date or an apology-date?"

"A real date. First the lunch date with you and then the apology dinner with Jennifer."

T-Two dates on the same day?"

"Is that going to be a problem? Because I can reschedule with Jennifer like that!" You said snapping your fingers to demonstration your point.

"Well,

It'll be fine as long as I come first." After you get back from your date with Nicole you start to feel sick and concussed. So you have to reschedule anyways.

If you don't mind, sorry." You move dinner with Jennifer to the weekend that way you can have some more time to get to know Nicole, but something happens after it that Really upsets Nicole.
1551112222121.title: Nicole's tears. Part two!

choices: Just before you can actually go anywhere, Beth text's Miranda.
Nothing happens and you do a little more walking around before seeing Nicole.
15511122221211.content:
"Um, I had a really good time and um, thank you for treating." Nicole said when you and her were back at the house.

"It was nothing, especially since you didn't eat that much, but thank you for picking such a nice place for lunch." You said smiling.

'Now I know he's just being nice, I ate a lot more than I normally do. I did that yesterday, too. Why am I eating so much around him? Maybe it's because I feel so comfortable around him. What ever the reason it has to stop! I can't gain anymore weight, especially now that I have someone to be skinny for.' Nicole's silence worried you a bit but eventually she spoke again. "Yeah it's a really nice place. We normally go there for girls-night, but sometimes just me and Alex go."

"So am I just another one of your girl friends...that sounded better in my head."

"No, I'm the girlfriend. You're the boyfriend...you are my boyfriend, right?"

"Of course, aren't you my girlfriend?"

"Y-Yes, of course! Um, s-so...how is your nose?"

"Pretty good actually, as long as I don't touch it. Why do you want to know?"

"Oh...um, I'm just worried about you."

"You still want that kiss, don't you."

Nicole blushed and smiled. "Y-Yes, but if your nose still hurts I can wait."

"Heh, I think you've waited long enough, just be careful, okay?"

"R-Really?! Um, okay..." Nicole began to look even more nervous as she inched her way closer to you.

While Nicole's shyness was cute you couldn't just watch her struggle. "What's the matter?"

"I'm sorry, I just don't want to hurt you by accident."

"Then let me help." You then used your hand to genitally move Nicole's head to the side and slowly leaned forward until your lips met hers. The kiss only lasted for a minute before you let out a quiet groan.

Nicole gently pulled away and looked at you with a worried expression. "Are you okay?! Did I hit your nose...o-or was the kiss bad?" Nicole asked sounding sad at the end.

"No no, it's okay. let's just try again...ugh."

"It was bad, wasn't it..."

"No no, it was good! Really good, it actually left me light headed! Which is normally a good thing, but when you might have a concussion, not so much...ugh."

Nicole wrapped her arm around you and began to pull you along. "Come on, I'm taking you to see Miranda."

Nicole took you through the house back to house doctors office and once inside she sat you down in the same spot as last time. "*Sigh*, what happened to him this time?"

"He's starting to feel concussed." Nicole said worryingly.

"Uh huh, and when did it start?" Miranda asked as she began to examine you again.

Nicole's cheeks went red again. "W-When I...kissed him." She said shyly.

Miranda rolled her eyes. "What did I tell you?! Not only could you have caused further damage to your nose but you were also depriving your brain of oxygen, which Yours need as much as it can get, as well as-wait...Nicole you kissed him?"

"Y-Yes, I did."

"Way to go Nicole! Though, don't you think you could do better than him?"

"You do realize you said that right in my face!"

"Y-Yeah and I really like him!"

"Okay, okay, calm down you two love birds I was just kidding."

"We're not in love!" You protested.

Nicole's eyes widened in shock. "W-We're not? I...I thought we were."

"Way to ruin that relationship, Romeo." Miranda mocked.

"I didn't mean it! I just didn't know if she liked me that much yet. I didn't want to ruin things but, I guess I just did that."

"No, I love you too much to be mad at you for that."

Miranda stopped examining you and smiled. "Then all is right, except for the fact that you have a concussion."

"Is it serious?!" Nicole asked.

"No, but I'm going to need to keep a eye on him to make sure it stays that way, but I've still got stuff need to do in here so his time wandering around today is over."

"I'll stay, too. He's my boyfriend and it's my job to make sure he's okay!"

"No no, you've got stuff to do, too. I'll see you tonight though, maybe we can fall asleep together on purpose this time." You offered. 'Did I just say that?! I'm horrible.'

Nicole's cheeks went red yet again. "M-Maybe...I'm gonna go now," Nicole then leaned over and kissed you on the forehead. "I'll miss you." Nicole turned around and hurried out of the room and left you alone with Miranda.

"So Norman, what are your intentions with my Nicole?" Miranda asked when Nicole was gone.

"Great, more jokes!"

"I'm being completely serious. We all look out for each other here, any one of us would ask the same question...though we might each word it a little differently."

"Listen, Nicole is a wonderful girl, I would never do anything to disrespect or hurt her, even if we were only friends."

"You think I'll believe that after you invited her to sleep with you?"

"I hate myself for saying that, but she didn't seem to mind."

"Well you're a good looking guy, I couldn't say that I would mind either."

"Yeah, I guess so-wait, what?"

"Gracie was right, it is funny to make you confused."

"This is going to be the rest of my day, isn't it."

While Miranda continued to...joke, with you, Nicole was humming happily to herself while she walked through the hall. 'I'm so happy he's okay, I don't think I could handle losing two Leroy men in my life, especially now that I'm dating one. I can't believe I actually went on a date with Mr. Norman! This has been the best day ever and it's not even dinner time yet! Which reminds me, I can't eat too much tonight and no matter what he says I'm not having a snack toni-'

"Nicole!" Gracie yelled as she came up behind her, derailing Nicole's train of thought.

"*Sigh*, hi Gracie, what do you want?" Nicole asked before Gracie pulled her into a hug.

"I'm never letting you out of my sight again!"

"What are you-"

"Which is why I'll be joining you and Norman when you have your little 'snack time' tonight."

"About that, I don't think I'm going to do that."

"Huh, why not?"

"Well, I've been eating to much lately and I don't want to gain any more weight. Especially since I have a boyfriend now."

"B-Boyfriend? Aww, how cute! You and Norman will make a great couple!"

"W-Wow...you took that better that I thought you would!"

"What did you think I was going to say? Your happiness is all that matters to me."

"Th-Thank you."

"Plus it will be that much easier for me to float the idea of a three-way."

"Gracie!"

"Hmm, I guess now is not the time, oh well. Anyways, why weren't you going to have snack time with Norman, again?"

"Because I'm eating too much! ...S-Sorry, I didn't mean to snap like that. I've just been feeling a little touchy about my weight..."

"Oooh, can I be touchy with your weight?"

"G-Gracie! I'm being serious!"

"I know, I know and I'm sorry. Hmm, if you're really worried about eating too much I can make sure you don't."

"R-Really? How would you do that?"

"I'll join you in you for snack time and when I think you've eaten enough I'll tell you to stop."

"That's a great idea! Thank you so much," Nicole smiled and hugged Gracie tight. "I really do like spending time with Mr. Norman and this way I don't have miss any time with him."

'She's still calling him 'Mr.' Noman? Kinky!' Gracie thought while the hug continued, which she eventually realized. "Are you enjoying yourself, sweetheart?" Gracie asked suggestively before trying to 'enjoy' the hug herself, namely by taking a hold of Nicole's love-handles.

"Gracie," Nicole yelled before pushing herself away from Gracie. "I'm going to find Alex, um, thank you again, I'll see you tonight."

"Kiss goodbye?"

Nicole frowned. "Goodbye Gracie." She then turned and walked away to find Alex.

For at least an hour all you and Miranda did was sit quietly while she worked, but eventually she finished. "That's about it, I'm finally all caught up!"

"Does this mean I can actually do something instead of sitting here for the rest of the day?"

"I don't see why not, but I'll still need to keep a eye on you."
15511122221211.title: "As long as I come first."

155111222212111.content:
*Bzzz*

"Hmm? What was-oh right my phone," Miranda stuck her hand into her pocket, pulled out her phone and began to read a text. "It's about time!"

"What, am I going to have to sit here even longer?!" You asked feeling a little annoyed.

"No, Beth just texted me that a lot of the vegetables finally came in and she needs my help to pick them all."

"She texted you? The garden is twenty feet from here!"

"She likes to text rather than talk."

"That's a little weird."

"Don't call her weird! She's just not a talkative person," Miranda said before standing up and grabbing you hand. "Now come on, where I go, you go!"

'What is it with these people and holding hands?' You thought while Miranda dragged you outside.

Once outside Miranda let go of your hand and walked over to Beth. "Alright Beth, lets get started. I heard on the news yesterday that there's going to be a bad storm in the morning and I know Kelly wont be happy if her ingredients are ruined."

"Heh, so that's why all the food she makes taste so good, she uses fresh ingredients." You said as you walked over to the two of them.

Beth looked at you for a while before she even acted like you where there. "Yeah..." It wasn't much though.

"Wow...you were right, Miranda, she isn't very talkative. Why is that?" You asked like Beth wasn't even there.

"It doesn't matter, she just doesn't." Miranda said sounding a little testy.

"I think it does, I'm a very caring and understanding person, you can tell me."

"It's really up to Beth, is it okay if I tell him?" Miranda asked Beth.

Beth looked at you blankly for a while before she shook her head. "It's fine..."

"Alright, I guess I should just get right into it. A few years ago...Beth was engaged, but before she and her fiance got married...he was shot and killed in a mugging!"

"W-What?! Th-that's horrible!"

"I know, since then she hasn't talked very much, but a few months ago she started to open up, then your father died. The only man she's gotten close to since her fiance died and then she almost completely stopped talking, again."

"That...that...I'm so sorry."

"It's okay...she may not talk much, but that doesn't keep her from having fun every now and then."

"I'm sorry, I know how it feels to lose someone you love, too, and I'm not talking about my father. You see...I was going to be engaged once."

Beth's eyes widened. "You were...what happened?"

"Um, don't tell Nicole, I don't know how she'll react if she heard any of this."

Miranda nodded her head. "I understand, we'll-well, I'll, keep it quiet."

"Good. It's a long story, so I'll keep it short. I used to be in love with a girl that I grew up with, well, I still do love her but...anyways. We had been dating since we were sixteen I think. We dated until I was twenty, which is when I finally worked up the nerve to ask her to marry me. I went out and bought the most expensive ring I could , but before I could give it to her she...she died in a house fire."

"That's terrible! I'm so sorry to hear that."

"No no, it's okay," You said forcing a smile. "Sure I miss her, more than anything else, but I've come to terms with her passing, even though she was so young. Though sometimes I stop to think about her and get a little sad that she's gone, but I tough it out because I know she wouldn't want me to stay sad. You know, my date with Nicole was the first time I had a date when I didn't feel sad after."

"You must really like her then."

"Yeah, she's a great-"

Your sentence was cut short when Beth hugged you out of nowhere. She wrapped her arms around you, held you tight and buried her head in your chest. "Sorry...I'm so sorry." As she held you close with her head in your chest, you could feel tears hitting your shirt.

"Uhh...there, there," You said as you awkwardly hugged Beth back. "It's-uh...okay."

"Ohh, Beth," Miranda cooed before placing a hand on Beth's back. "Come here."

Beth then broke away from your awkward hug and switched to Miranda and did the same to her as to you. She wrapped her arms around tight Miranda and buried her head in her chest. When Beth finally calmed down you offered her to talk to you any time she needed to. Miranda then examined you one more time and when she was done, she told you that you would be fine and that you could leave if you wanted to. "Are you sure that you don't need any help picking the vegetables?" You asked, making sure you weren't needed.

"Yeah, me and Beth should be able to handle it. You go have fun with Nicole, but not too much fun!" Miranda warned.

"I wasn't planing on doing the thing you were probably thinking but, okay." You said before starting to walk out of the garden.

"And if you hurt yourself again I'm not going to help you, well, it's my job to so I will, but I won't be happy about it!" Miranda yelled just before you re-entered the house. You walked through the house...but where are you going?

To see Nicole of course, you're not going to let anything rain on your parade...or something like that.

Not to see Nicole...and not the other thing.
155111222212111.title: To see, or not to see...*eh-hm*.

choices: Worried about you, Nicole convinces Sophie and Gracie to look for you.
Caring more about Nicole than you, Sophie convinces Nicole to leave you alone.
1551112222121111.content:
With all her work done for the day, Nicole was in her room with Gracie, waiting for you to show up for 'snack time'. Nicole, for the first time in two nights, had changed into her pajamas. Her bottoms were pink just like her top (the same goes for probably everything else she owned), but the top had a dog's black paw print. It was an older pair and was tight on her, but Gracie had convinced her to wear it. Her stomach made her top ride up on it and couldn't keep the last two inches of it her stomach covered. Her breast stretched out the neck hole and left a little more of her breast on view than it should have and it even stretched out the paw print a little bit. While her bottoms were stretched tight across her expanded thighs, rear, and dug into her hips, giving her a slight muffin-top. "I'm not to sure about this Gracie. This is all really tight," Nicole said while trying to pull her top just a little bit lower. "Are you sure he's going to like this?"

Gracie sat down next to Nicole on her bed and then scouted closer to her. "I know I do." She said with a big smile.

"I'm changing." Nicole said plainly as she stood up.

Gracie reached for Nicole's arm and pulled her back down onto her bed. "No don't, I'm sorry, I'm just trying to be supportive, but I'll shut up...but you can trust me, he'll love it!"

"I don't know...I'm feeling...big, I think I'm gonna change."

"Come on, you look great!"

"Are you sure?"

"For the-one-two-three-four-Fourth time, you look great! Feel better now?"

"A little bit...so you're su-" Nicole stopped when she got the death-glare from Gracie. "Sorry...I'm just nervous...I-I've never dressed this way for a boy before."

"Ooooh, have you dressed this way for a Girl before?" Gracie asked with a raised eyebrow and a suggestive tone.

"N-NO! Th-That's not what I meant! I just meant that I...I mean I...I didn't...NO!" Nicole managed to stammer out.

"If not, then why are you getting so defensive?"

"Because I...I'm not...I don't...my tummy hurts." Nicole pouted before clutching her 'tummy' in her hands.

Gracie gave Nicole a pout. "Aww, sooo-cute! Alwight, iwf I makin' you tummy huwt I stop." Gracie said with a puppy dog face.

"I mean it! This whole situation is making me feel...not good...I think I should change."

"Here we go again, for the fifth and final time. You. Look. Fine!"

"I'm sorry, I just really, Really, want to impress Norman...but, I...I feel to big for that."

"Oh my-what did I just say! Nicole, just because you a little on the heavy side, doesn't mean you can't be attractive!"

"I'm not saying that...I know there's at least one plus side." Nicole said before poking a finger into one of her breast.

Gracie let a few short giggles before stopping herself. "I think you're over looking a...Bigger, more, southern, plus side."

"I don't...Oh! W-What's so good about a big belly?"

Gracie quietly muttered something to herself before saying something more...understandable. "Behind that, Nicole!"

"Huh," Nicole asked before turning her head in a cute attempt to see behind herself. "What do you mean?"

"Oh come on Nicole! Okay, let's try this. Just fill in the blank. I like big-blanks-and I can not lie. Get it now?"

"...No."

"Nicole, I love you but, sometimes you can be a little slow, so I'm just going going to say it. You've got a big butt Nicole!" Gracie said very bluntly.

"Gracie! That's so rude!"

"No princess, it's a complement!"

"It is? G-Guy's like girl's w-with big...butt's?"

"Geez, how long has it been since you've seen the world above that rock?" Gracie asked sarcastically.

"What rock?"

"Along time then, huh. Anyways, yes some guy's do like a girl with a big...rear-end, as you're probably more used to hearing. Oh, and some girl's like 'em, too."

"...I think I want to change now."

Then, as if on cue, you entered. "Hello! Sorry I took so long, but-"

Once seeing you Gracie lounged at you and grabbed you tight. "I'm so happy to see you! Please take me away from this horribly repetitive conversation, anywhere, I don't care...but preferably somewhere with a bed...or couch...or anywhere we can lay down."

"Hello Gracie," You said plainly, trying to pry the clingy girl off of you and once you did, you turned your gaze from Gracie to Nicole, but once you saw her your cheeks went red and you turned your head away. "Oh...I didn't realize you were changing, Nicole."

"But...I'm not." Nicole said feeling really confused.

You turned your head back to Nicole and looked her over again. 'Sorry, I don't know what I was thinking.' You thought to yourself. "Well, I was only looking at one spot," You said aloud. "Stupid, said the out loud thing in my head and the in my head thing out loud...that one was supposed to be in my head, too."

"I told you he'd like it!" Gracie joked.

"Geez, you're such a pervert!" Sophie said as she came into the room.

Nicole's eyes widened. "S-Sophie! What are you-"

"See, this is why I took so long-"

"I don't trust this guy with you, especially since you two are...dating now, but it looks like I didn't have to worry about you two being alone, do I Gracie? Hey, should I invite everyone else, since it's such a big party in here?" Sophie asked sarcastically.

"This is becoming less and less what I wanted it to be." Nicole said glumly.

"Look on the bright side, Nicole." Gracie said with a big smile.

"What's that?"

"That three-way just became a foursome!"

"...I want to leave my room now."

There was a awkward silence until you decided to break it. "So...I-uh, went into the kitchen and grabbed enough snacks for me, you and Sophie," You said looking at Nicole. "But now that Gracie is here I don't think there's enough, so she can have mine."

"A-Are you sure? You didn't have anything last time, either." Nicole asked.

"He didn't," Gracie asked, faking a surprised tone. "That's just another nail in you F.A. coffin."

"F.A? What the heck is a F.A.?" Sophie asked.

"Yeah. Gracie, please explain that phrase that no-one else here knows but you?" You asked with a smug tone that only Gracie picked up on.

"...Never-mind." Gracie said with a role of her eyes. 'Damn, first Miranda and now Norman...I'm losing my edge!'

A smile came to your face as you let a short chuckle out. "Alright then, this is for you, Nicole." You said before handing a brown paper bag to Nicole.

Nicole opened the bag and looked inside. "Cookie's!" She squealed happily, but before she took a bite out of one she looked to Gracie, who nodded her head, and then she took a bite out of a cookie.

"And Sophie, I noticed that this is your favorite and while it's not breakfast, well, here." You said before passing a plastic container to Sophie.

Sophie took the lid off of the container as she sat down on the floor and when she saw what was inside her face lit up. "French-toast! Thank you s-Er...thanks..." Though excited at first, her tone changed when she remembered who she was talking to, then perked up again when she took her first bite.

"And for Gracie..." You said before tossing Gracie her snack.

Gracie caught her snack, looked at it and then stared at you blankly. "An apple...Nicole gets cookies, Sophie gets French-toast...and you were going to have a apple?"

"I like apples, but if you don't I can always go get you something different." You offered.

"This will be fine, thanks." Gracie said, motioning the apple at you and then taking a bite.

You looked at Nicole who was happily nibbling on her first cookie and Gracie sitting next to her, taking what could only be described as 'angry', bites out of of her apple. Nicole's bed wasn't as big as yours (not that hers was small yours was just much bigger) and there was only enough room for two the way they were sitting, and while you wanted to sit with Nicole, you didn't want to listen to any ideas that Gracie might have for tuning it into a three person space. So you just opted for sitting next to Sophie on the floor, but when you did Sophie gave you a look and then scouted away from you, not even bothering to stop munching on her French-toast. You tried to make her feel more comfortable by giving her a smile, but that only made a confused look come to her face.

'What the hell?! Why are you smiling at me? Your girlfriend is right there, smile at her,' As if her thought's had 'somewhat', affected your actions, you then looked at Nicole, then you smile faded away. 'That's...a little better I guess...but why did you stop smiling? Man, you're acting extra weird tonight, aren't you?'

You then muttered something under your breath, so quietly only someone close to you could hear, which Sophie was. You closed your eyes and pushed yourself off of the floor. "I'm sorry." You said before walking Nicole's bedroom door.

"N-Norman, where are you going?" Nicole asked worryingly when you reached the door. You looked back at her but didn't say anything, then you just left.
1551112222121111.title: PJ's.

choices: You wake up on your own to see that Nicole isn't in bed any more.
Nicole wakes you up with a kiss.
15511122221211111.content:
"M-Mr. Norman, are you okay?" Alex asked from outside your door.

"We're all worried about you." Jennifer added.

Ruby rolled her eyes. "Not all!" She yelled. When Ruby learned that you were held up in your room, they had no choice but to tell her who you were and she didn't take it well.

You slowly opened the door barely enough for you to see out. "I'm sorry...but I just want to alone...please." You then tried to close the door but Sophie used her hand to keep it open.

"NO! Listen you jerk, Nicole is in her room, alone, crying her eyes out, because she thinks she did something wrong. Now for what-ever reason why, Nicole likes you a lot and you owe her an explanation for what-ever the hell is wrong with you!" She demanded.

"...I didn't know...tell her to come here...I don't feel like leaving my room..." Sophie moved her hand away from the door and you slammed it shut.

Gracie then left the others to fetch Nicole and when she came came back with her, Nicole sheepishly knocked on the door. She had at some point changed out of her tight pajamas and into a looser pair, the top had the same black paw print but because of its bigger size it wasn't being stretched. "Mr. N-Norman, *sniff, sniff*, I'm sorry, I...I didn't mean to *hic*, upset you...p-please forgive me." Nicole said as she tried to fight back her tears.

You opened the door again and gently pulled Nicole inside. "You better not hurt her!" Sophie yelled again as the door clicked shut.

"I wonder if I could make something to cheer them up?" Ilene asked.

"Heh, you'd only make it worse!" Joked Kate.

"This isn't the time! My poor Nicole is so sad and there's nothing I can do about it!" Gracie said with a pouty face.

"My, my, what's going on up here? Every one gathered outside the master bedroom, I haven't seen that since Harold was-oh no. What happened to him now?" Miranda asked as she and Beth came down the hallway.

"Nothing yet, but I'll tell you what's going to happen to him if HE HURTS NICOLE!!!" Sophie yelled yet again.

Miranda blinked a few times before speaking again. "...So it's not what's wrong with him it's what he did?"

"Yeah, me, Norman, Nicole and Gracie were having a fine time in Nicole's room-"

Miranda laughed. “Did you have fun?"

"...When out of nowhere he looked at Nicole, frowned, said a girls name and left!" Sophie said after Miranda made her suggestive outburst.

Miranda sighed and turned to Beth. "You don't think he-"

Beth nodded her head. "Yeah...poor Norman."

"What are you two talking about?" Sophie asked.

Miranda started to fish around in the pockets of her doctors coat and eventually pulled out nines stethoscopes. "Why don't we all find out!"

You looked at Nicole, not saying a word, only taking the occasional deep breath. "M-Mr. Norman, I'm so sorry, just tell me what I did wrong and I'll never do it again," Nicole looked at you expecting a response, but was met with silence. "Was I eating too much? I know I've been eating a lot and that I've gained a lot of weight, but I can eat less and I can lose weight!"

"*Sigh*."

"That's it, isn't it...okay, I'll stop eating, I'll work out, I'll do what even it takes for you to-"

"Stop." Nicole's eyes widened, you had finally said something after being so awkwardly silent.

"W-What...Oh! D-Do you want me to stop eating? ...Oka-"

"I can't take this anymore." You said as you stood on your feet.

"What's wrong," Nicole asked worryingly. "Please tell me...you're scaring me!"

You smiled and started to laugh, which given the situation, was a little...disturbing, to Nicole. "I'm sorry, I'm doing it again! It's just, you have to be, the sweetest girl in the whole world!"

"W-What?"

"Even though you've done nothing wrong, even though you've been the most perfect girl, you'd still change yourself, just to make me happy. I don't deserve you in the slightest way! You should never think that how much you weigh, or how big you are, will ever affect how I feel about you! I told you before I don't have a size preference in women, b-but...uh, e-even if I did, that would never make me love you less, or make me want to lose weight for me, I'd be the one who would need to change, not you!"

"M-Mr. Norman, you...you...I...I'M SO SORRY!" Nicole said as she broke down crying again.

"No no, don't start crying again," You begged as you sat back down pulled Nicole into a hug. "It's not you fault, it's mine, I really need to think more before I act, because every time I don't, I end up hurting you!"

Nicole genitally pushed herself away from you. "S-So...if...if I didn't make you upset...what did?"

"I didn't want to tell this, I didn't want to upset you, but I made you so sad by keeping you in the dark. So I'll tell you..." You then told Nicole what you did Miranda and Beth, only instead of making it the short version, you told the long one instead. "...Which is why, when I looked at you and thought of how happy you make me, just by being in the same room as you...I couldn't help but think of her and I didn't want to get so emotional over her in front of you, so I left, but if I knew what it would do to you I wouldn't have."

"Mr. Norman...I can't even begin to say how sorry I am."

"It's okay, I am, too."

"S-So...if you, I mean...if...never mind."

"What? You can ask or tell me anything, you don't need to be shy."

"I just...promise you wont get mad at me?"

"Of course, now what is it?"

"Okay...I feel really bad for even wondering this but, if she was...still alive and you had to pick, between me or her, w-which of us would you choose?"

"Heheh, I can't blame you for wondering that. I've actually been asked that before, but the answer is always the same, her-"

"Oh...I understand, if I were you I'd-"

"But."

"But?"

"But, with you, I'd probably die trying to find a way to have you both!"

"I...I think I'd be willing to share." Nicole said as she laid down on your bed. After what Nicole said, there was a loud thud and the someone yelled Gracie's name.

"What was that?"

"I...I don't...know." Nicole said while she got comfortable.

"Are you about to fall asleep," Nothing. You smiled, got up, covered Nicole with a blanket and walked out of your room. "She really likes my bed...wait, what are you all looking at?"

"..."

When no-one said anything you looked at Miranda who then started to whistle "What did you say?!"

"Well," Miranda said as she pulled one of the stethoscopes. "It's more like what you said."

"...One, why do you keep such weird stuff in your pockets, and two, you spied on me?!"

"Yeah...we kinda all did..."

"Then I'm guessing that when Gracie heard Nicole say she'd be willing to share...wait, where is Gracie?"

"S-She punched the wall...so Jennifer took her downstairs to ice her hand." Replied Alex.

"So that's what that noise was. ...So...you heard...everything, I said?" You asked.

"Yeah...we're all...sorry, I guess." Ruby said with her arms crossed.

"Yeah, but don't get used to this sympathy! Just because you lost someone doesn't change how we feel about you!" Sophie added.

"Please...don't talk like that." Beth asked.

"No no, it's fine, they don't have to like me if they don't want to, but that's not going to stop me from being nice to either of you!" You said giving them both a smile.

"Whatever, creep. Anyways, now that this whole thing has been sorted out we need you to start on some paperwork to do in the morning, we need to sort out the rest of the will."

"Of course."

"Norman...are you sure you're going to be okay?" Beth asked, speaking the most words you have ever heard her say at once.

"Yeah, like I said, sometimes I get sad, but I tough it out. Anyway, I should find somewhere to sleep-"

"Why? You've got a big bed in your room?" Miranda asked.

"B-Because...Nicole's sleeping there!"

"So, from what you've told me you've done it before!"

"Well it's one thing to do it by accident, but-"

"Come on, I'm sure she'd be happy to wake up next to you!"

"I guess, she is under the blanket, I could sleep on top of it."

"Just shut up and go to bed already!" Sophie yelled before pushing you back into your room and closing the door behind you.

You looked at Nicole laying down in your bed. Before you left she was spread out across most of the bed, but now she was laying on just one side. You then changed out of your day-clothes (making sure that Nicole's eyes were still shut while you did) and into your night-clothes. Once you were changed you laid down next to Nicole and when you did Nicole's eyes opened shortly before closing again. "My Norman." She said before wrapping her arm around you.

The next morning you wake up, but is it on your own or dose Nicole wake you up?

You wake up on your own to see that Nicole isn't in bed any more, so you go to look for her and when you do, she has just hung up her phone.

Nicole wakes you up with a kiss and tells you Ilene and Kelly made you both a couples breakfast, but you get her to eat most of it.
15511122221211111.title: My Norman.

choices: Nicole tells you at the last minute.
155111222212111111.content:
Nicole had been up and about for about a half hour, but it would be another full one before she needed to wake you. She had changed out of her pajamas and into her maids uniform and was just about to leave her room when she remembered something. 'It's been a few day's since I've checked my messages, I wonder if I've got any new ones?'

Nicole opened up a drawer, pulled out her phone and started to check her messages. "Let's see...oh there's a whole bunch! Lets see, one from Abbey, three from Alex...*Sigh*, twenty seven from Gracie, two from Kim, one from Nick, two from Rebe-wait, Nick," Nicole checked the message which told Nicole to call him as soon as she could. "...Nick? Um, hey, you said you had something to tell me? ...You got transferred...only thirty minutes away? Th-That's great! I can see you all the time now, when can I come visit you? ...Y-You're coming here?! W-When...t-ten days?! ...W-What do you mean? Of course I'm excited! Th-That should give me just enough time to get ready for you...what kid? Oh you mean Mr. Norman? H-He's really nice I...yes he's a guy...you didn't mind when I worked for his father...what's that supposed to mean? You think I'm some girl who's going to sleep with any young guy who waves a bunch of money in my face? ...No, I'm sorry, but you need to trust me more...okay, I'll see you soon...I love you, too, bye." Nicole hung up her phone and let out a sigh.

*Knock, knock, knock.*

"Nicole? Are you in there?" You asked from the outside Nicole's bedroom door.

"EEP," Nicole fumbled with her phone before shoving it back in the drawer. "Um, y-yeah, come in!"

You opened the door and came in. "Hey, where did you go? I woke and you weren't there, I got a little worried."

"Sorry, I um, couldn't sleep so I, uh, got up early..."

"Are you okay Nicole? You look like you've got something on your mind."

"I, uh...no, I'm fine."

"Alright, but if that changes tell me and I'll do whatever I can to help."

"...Okay...h-how about we get some breakfast, it will be our first one as a couple?"

"Sounds great, but every meal is only going to get better with the more time we spend together."

"Y-You're so sweet..."

"No no, that was pretty corny-" *growl* "...D-Did I just make you hungry?"

Nicole's cheeks went red. "I-I'm sorry!"

"No no, it's fine, I think it was actually pretty cute," You said smiling. "Well...more than cute actually."

"W-What do you mean?"

"Eh-never-mind. How about we go and get something in your big hungry belly?" You asked before putting your hand on Nicole's stomach and pressed on it lightly. 'I hope I'm not coming on too strong.'

Nicole's blush went an even deeper shade of red at you touch and you could feel her trying to suck her stomach in. "I'm sorry...um, maybe I shouldn't eat anything."

"No no, that's unhealthy. You'll only end up eating more later. If you really think you need to...lose weight, you should just try to have something healthy..." You regretfully suggested.

"Uh, y-yeah, I think I'll do that..."

"Oh...alright...if that's what you want..." You said feeling a little disappointed.

Nicole began to nervously play with a lock of her hair, pulling at it hand over hand. "M-Mr. Norman...what do you want?"

"Well...I want you to drop that Mr. thing."

"Y-You know that's not what I meant...do you really not care whether or not I lose weight?"

"*Sigh*, I guess I would be pretty disappointed...but you do whatever you want, I'll be the one who changes, not you."

"Um, it's okay...it's not a big deal, you want it and I need to do it for me."

"...Wait, do you mean-"

"And you don't have to help, but um, if you do you could see me in some really s...work out clothes. You don't need to worry, I'll-uh, be tiny for you soon."

"Nicole...I think you misunderstood me. I didn't mean I would be disappointed if you Didn't lose weight...but if you did."

"...Y-You...l-like me...fat?"

"I wouldn't call you fat...just a little chubby, but that's beside the point. I really don't have a size preference in women...but I do tend to lean more towards...*eh-hm*, bigger women...well, maybe more than lean."

"S-So...you do think I look good?"

"Of course, no, better than good, beautiful."

"R-Really, you think I'm beautiful?"

"It wasn't the first word that came to mind but yeah, beautiful."

"I...I really don't know what to think...do you um, what me to get even...bigger?"

"No no, I'll love you at any size...but...I can't say I would be upset."

"I...I don't...this is just so weird."

"Yeah, that's what I want to hear."

"Oh! N-No I didn't mean y-you I..." Nicole lowered her head and her eyes started to water. "...I just don't know what to say or do!"

"You don't have to do anything...like I said, I'll change myself for you!"

"I don't want you to do that...and I want to make you happy no matter what it takes but-"

"If you're this unsure then you don't need to do anything for me."

"But I am sure...I want to make you happy anyway I can...but-"

"But what?"

Nicole tells you that the reason she's so conflicted is because of the man she just talked to on the phone, but dose she do it now, or just before he arrives?
155111222212111111.title: Well, maybe more than maybe.

choices: Keep us a secret for right now...but I swear I'll tell him eventually!"
Tell him after I introduce you...If you really think it's a good idea..."
1551112222121111112.content:
It has been eleven days since Jennifer ran you over with her door and bruised your nose and three days since Miranda told you that you could remove the bandage and despite Nicole's protest, she thought you looked cute with it on, you took it off.

You walked through the house looking for Nicole and she was sleeping peacefully on a love-seat, curled up in a ball so that her whole body was on it when you found her. You smiled to yourself and placed a hand on her shoulder and gently started to shake her awake. "Hey, wake up. I hate to do this but you aren't going to sleep well tonight if you nap all day."

"Hmm? I feel asleep? I just sat down to to take a rest. I guess I was really tiered..." Nicole said while she slowly sit up.

"I'd think so, you've been running yourself ragged for a week and a half!" You said before sitting down next to her.

Nicole's eyes widened. "Th-That's right! I need to get back to work!" Nicole tried to get up but you genitally pulled her back down.

"It's okay, I asked Jennifer and Sophie if you could take the day off to rest and they said it was fine...more or less... So just sit back and relax so you can get some of your energy back."

"I, um, have plenty of energy! I just needed to take a quick rest and I um, fell asleep, t-that's all! N-Now let me up, I-I've got to get back to work!"

"Nicole, are you okay? You've been acting strange even since I...you know...I told you what I thought of your weight...is that's what's been bothering you?"

"N-No! I told you I'd do this for you, I've already gained five pounds! Um...I know it's not much though, but I've really been trying and to tell you the truth..." Nicole looked down. She put her hand on her stomach and started rubbing it lovingly through her maids uniform. "...I actually kind of like it..."

"I thought you were getting a little softer," You said before placing a hand on her shoulder. "And I'm happy to here that you like it, but if it's not that then what is it? You've really been worrying me!"

"I have? I...I didn't mean to. I just, um, didn't want to tell you yet, but I guess today has to be the day that I do."

"What is it? You know you can tell me anything."

"Mm-hm, which is why I feel so bad. Um...uh...okay, t-the morning after our first date...just before you came into my room...I was talking to someone on my phone that um, I didn't want you to know about for a while."

"W-Who was it?"

"His name is Nick and...and he's coming to visit today."

"Uhh, okay, I don't see why you were so worked up over a friend coming to visit."

"But...he's not just a friend...he's...my...my b...b..."

"Are you...trying to say boyfriend?!"

"W-What?! N-No, I would never have two boyfriends at once! I um, was trying to say...brother..."

"...Heheh, is that all? I thought it was something serious." You said smiling, taking Nicole in you arms.

Nicole pushed herself away. "It is though! He's um, never liked the idea of me being around guys."

"How long did you work for my father?" You asked with a raised eyebrow.

"He didn't mind that...he didn't think I would go for some one so much older than me...but you're..."

"Younger, right. Well," You took Nicole's hand and squeezed it. "We both love each other a lot, I think he'll be happy when he sees how happy we make each other."

"Um...about that, I-uh, didn't exactly tell him about us yet...I'm so sorry...are you mad at me?"

You let go of Nicole's hand and let it fall to her side. "...*Sigh*, I could never get mad at you, but I am mad at myself for not being able to make you think that."

Nicole's eyes started to water up as she wrapped her arms around you and pulled you into her soft body and you hugged her back. "I'm so sorry! You are the greatest man I've ever met! I don't deserve you! You've been so kind and gentle with me. When ever you hold me I feel so safe and confident. I think that you're the most attractive man I've ever been with and you make me feel so much more beautiful than I know I am!"

You pushed away from Nicole but kept one arm around her waist. You started to move locks of her white hair out of her face as well as wipe the tears away from pale skin with your other hand and then smiled. "You are the most beautiful woman I have been with in so long. I can't understand why you can't see that for yourself and while I've tried to convince you of that with words, I think I'll just have to show you how attractive you really are."

"W-What do you mean?"

"I'll tell you, but first, I have a few questions. What would be the most soundproof room in the house?"

"Um...the bedrooms, the music room or the house doctors office. The house doctors office for doctor patient confidentiality, the music room so that no sound can interrupt anyone inside or out of the room and the bedrooms because, um, you know," Nicole's cheeks went red. "They're bedrooms, why?"

"Mm-hm, and which of these rooms is your favorite, the music room, the house doctors office, your room or my room?"

"Um...I guess your room...because you're usually there...w-why?" Nicole asked as her cheeks went an even deeper shade of red.

"Last one and the I'll tell you. When is your brother supposed to get here?"

"Um...not until five...why do you want to know?"

"It's about one...we should have enough time."

"T-Time for wha-oh...oh! M-Mr. Norman, do you think we sho-EEP!" Nicole squealed when you took her hand and led her to your room.

Nicole rolled over and wrapped her arm around you. She pulled you close and you sank into her while she buried her head in you chest. "I take it you enjoyed yourself," Nicole pulled her head out of your chest and nodded. "Do you know you're beautiful now?" Nicole nodded her head a second time only much faster, which made you laugh.

Nicole sat up in your bed and pulled the blankets over her bare chest. "Um...Norman," You were happy about her not calling you Mr. Norman, but unsettled by the concern in her voice. "That night, when we had our first date, um, just before you came in my room, Gracie and I were talking-"

"Oh no."

"...Um, about my size and um...she said that some guys like girls with...um...bigger rears...and I was wondering...do you? Because at first I didn't believe her, but after that...performance, I'm not too sure." Nicole said as her cheeks went red.

"It's not my least favorite part of you."

"Y-You have a least favorite part of me?"

"No no, I love every little thing about you! Just...maybe that a little more?" You said, moving your hand over her love handle.

Nicole laughed as she put her hand over yours and squeezed it. "I always though they named these to be ironic, but again, after that performance," She said, giving you a shy smile and when she looked in your eyes her smile grew wider. "I love you so much, you are the most beautiful person I've ever met...and you showed me how beautiful I am."

You used the arm you still had wrapped around Nicole to bring he closer to you. "Sounds like you're talking to a mirror."

Nicole wrapped her arms around you and pulled you back into her naked form. "You're so sweet, I never want either of us to ever move from this spot!"

"If we never move for this spot then we'll never be able to do that again."

"...Okay, maybe for s-"

"And your brother would probably walk in on us cudgeling...naked."

"I guess you're-"

"We'd eventually get hungry and need to use the bathro-"

"Why can't you just enjoy the sentiment?"

"I'm sorry, hey, can you see what time it is?"

"Yeah, um...it is-oh no, it's four! My brothers going to be here in an hour! I've got to get ready!"

"Really? Only four?"

"I've got to shower, get dressed, redo my makeup, untangle my hair. We should Really clean up in here and you've got to shower and get dressed, too!"

'Don't say it, don't say it, DO NOT SAY IT!!!' "Maybe it would be faster if we shower together?" 'Why do I bother?!'

"Um, if you really think it will speed things up..."

'...I'm going to forgive myself just this once.'

It was only ten minutes before five when Nicole was finally finishing getting you dressed. "Almost got it." She said while tying your tie.

"I can't believe you got me into this...I hate suit's"

"I'm sorry you don't like it, but I'm really happy you're doing this for me. I just want you to make a good impression, if he likes you it'll be easier for me to tell him about us."

"I thought you were going to tell him no matter what?"

"I am! I'll tell him before he leaves...I just want him to like you...I really don't want to lose you, I don't think my heart could take it."

"Don't worry, I'll never do anything to hurt you...but wouldn't it be easier if you told him right away? It'd give him more time to like me...and we wont have to go around telling everyone to pretend we aren't together, right?"

"...Y-Yeah...um, that would save time...if I didn't already..."

"...Okay...I'm a little hurt but, okay."

Nicole lowered her head. "I'm sorry, I really do hate lying...and it's not anything to do with you, really! I just thought this would be easier for me...I know being selfish...but-"

You placed a finger over Nicole's lip's to silence her. "Don't be upset, I understand. You do what ever it takes for you feel comfortable."

"Okay...I think I'll just,
