15511122221211111122.content:
"Ah-choo!" Gracie sneezed. She and Alex were waiting in the foyer, waiting for Nick to arrive. Like almost every one else, they had changed into a dress for the occasion.

"Are you okay Gracie? Are you cold? Are you sick?" Alex asked worryingly.

"Nah, I'm fine. Just felt like I had to sneeze."

Alex smiled. "Oh, maybe someone is talking about you."

A smile of her own crept onto Gracie's face, but it was much more...something, than Alex's. "Ooo, I hope it's Nicole!"

"*Sigh*, d-don't you think you stop thinking like that? I mean, s-she is with Mr. Norman now."

"Yeah, I guess you're right...normally, but tonight, as far as anyone's concerned, she's single and fair game!"

"M-maybe you should stop obsessing over Nicole, Gracie, and start trying to find another girl...o-or guy...or both...or what ever a Gracie is into."

Gracie stared at Alex blankly before her sly smile came back to her face. "...Are you trying to suggest something, Alex?"

Alex's cheeks went deep red. "W-What? No, I'm j-just trying to say that...maybe you'd be happier if you were in a...actual r-relationship?"

"...Are you trying to suggest something?"

"Just drop it Gracie."

*Knock, knock, knock.*

"Oh, that must be Nick, you get the door, and I’ll go get Nicole!" Gracie shouted excitedly as she took off running up the main staircase.

Alex let out a sigh as she straightened out her green dress and opened the front door. "Hello Nick, it's n-nice to see you again."

"It's nice to see you, too. How have you been?"

"I-I’m fine, thank you. Why don't you come in, Gracie just went to get Nicole."

"...Alone?"

Gracie hummed to herself as she walked through the hall to Nicole's room. 'So long as I do it in front of Nick, Norman can't say anything about me flirting with Nicole! Heheh, this is gonna to be so-' every thought in Gracie's mind ended abruptly when she opened Nicole's bedroom door. The only thing that Gracie heard was the sound her world shattering. "You...you two had sex?"

A deep red blush came to your face as you finished pulling up the zipper to Nicole's new dress. "No no, we didn't have sex, I...I was just...h-helping Nicole with her zipper, she was fully clothed when she asked!" You lied.

"You can't lie to me about this! I can see it Nicole's eyes! You two had sex!"

'...Good bye dumb luck, you will be missed.'

"Um, Gracie...you of all people should know what happens, uh, when two people love each other very much..." Nicole tried to explain, an intense blush coming to her face as she did.

"...Fine, but call me next time! We could all have some real fun!"

You moved form behind Nicole to in front of her and looked at her. "Nicole? What do you think? Yes? No?"

"No."

"What I thought," You turned from Nicole and to Gracie. "NO!"

Gracie shrugged her shoulders. "Fine, maybe Alex will be more cooperative."

"L-Leave Alex alone Gracie...she, uh...doesn't handle being teased well..."

"Aw~, Nicowe, is you jelwous?" Gracie asked in her cutesy but still suggestive tone.

Nicole's eyes widened and she started acting more nervous than normal, so you stepped in to save her. "Come on Gracie, leave her alone! You know stuff like this upsets her. She's so uncomfortable with the thought that she can't even dispute it," Nicole stayed quiet but still nodded her head up and down quickly to show she agreed. "Now let’s just go down stairs and wait for Nick to get here."

"OH! ...Yeah, about that...he's already here...whoops."

"...Ugh." You moaned as you put a hand on the side of your head.

"Norman? Are you okay?" Nicole asked concerned.

"Y-Yeah, why wouldn't it be? I've just got a little headache is all...anyways, lets get downstairs before Nick comes up here and sees us, he might figure out we're together!" You moved your hand away from the side of your head and moved toward the door, but Nicole stopped you by grabbing you hand with hers.

You turned around and saw the same worry that filled Nicole's voice was also in her eyes. "Um, but...we decided that we were just going to tell him. It wouldn't matter if he saw us together..." Nicole paused as she squeezed you hand harder. "...Are you sure you're okay?"

"Yeah, why wouldn't I be?" You asked with a confused look on you face.

"Oh crap! I broke him...cool!" Gracie smiled before leaving Nicole's room with the same happy stride as when she came.

"I don't know what you two are talking about, I'm perfectly fine. I've just got a little stomachache." Just as you finished talking Nicole let go of your arm and you left her room.

Nicole shook her head and then hurried after you. 'I thought he said it was a headache?'

When you and Nicole reached the bottom of the stairs you saw Alex, Gracie and Miranda standing around the man you assumed to be Nick, while Beth sat quietly on the other side of the foyer in a silver dress. "Wait, it’s silver? I thought she would have worn something with more of an earthy-wait! Beth is in a dress...Huh.' You thought as you and Nicole walked over to the others. If the man really was Nick, he looked nothing like Nicole. Set aside the fact he had pigment, (his hair was black, eyes brown and skin tan) they shared none of the same facial features and they didn't look to be the same height, in fact, if you weren't told that they were related, you would never have guessed it. Nick was wearing a pair of black jeans and a white t-shirt...while every one else was dressed up. 'Okay, so Nicole makes me wear a suit, but her brother doesn't have to wear anything special at all...lucky.'

As you walked over to them, Miranda saw you and smiled. "Speaking of him, here comes the walking injury now," She laughed before looking you up and down. "Well don't you look nice?" Miranda joked.

"Hey at least I tried," You motioned towards Miranda's dress, which was really just her doctor’s coat but buttoned all that way up. "Didn't you have a real dress in those bottomless pockets of yours?"

"*Eh-hmm*, while those two do...what ever it is they're doing, why don't you give your brother a hug?" Nick asked with his arms outstretched, while you and Miranda continued to argue.

Nicole smiled and wrapped her arms around her brother, embarrassing him in a short hug, braking away soon after. "It's good to see you Nick, um, so how have been? I uh, haven't really talked to you in a week and a half."

"Fine, most of that time I've just been packing and not much else. What about you, how have you been?"

"Um, I've been good, but-uh, there is something I really need to talk to you about," Nicole turned away from Nick and to you and Miranda, both of you still arguing. "Um, Norman, could you stop um, fighting and-uh, introduce yourself?"

You ended your argument with Miranda and turned to Nick and Nicole. "Oh, I’m sorry. My name is Norman; it's nice to meet you!" You said, out stretching your hand.

"Nick, nice to meet you, too." Nick said as he shook your hand.

'He seems nice enough. I have no idea what Nicole was so worried about!' You thought after you broke the handshake.

"So, Nicole said she needed to tell me something important, and apparently you're involved, so speak up! You didn't get her pregnant did you? Because if so you can just save me the trouble and go bury yourself." You felt like you should laugh, but after looking in Nick's eyes you realized he wasn't completely joking.

'Oh...so this is what Nicole was worried about...ugh.' You thought as your heart started to race. "No no, we haven't...she's not pregnant..." Not telling someone something isn't the same as lying...right?

"Nick...um, I lied to you...the day I called you, I told you that nothing would happen between me and Norman...but-uh, something already did-" Nick looked back at you with the same stare as only a few moments ago. "-The day before I called, me and Norman had gone on our first date, and we have gone on several since then...I'm sorry."

Nick looked back at Nicole and frowned. "Why are always apologizing for things that aren't your fault? It's ridiculous!"

"I'm s-Err...I don't know...I just feel like I need to sometimes..."

"Well, this isn't one of those times. I'm sure you've made a good choice this time. Now, I assume that since every one is dressed up that I should expect a fancy meal?"

"Yup, too bad Kelly made most of it." Ilene said as she entered the room, with Kelly close behind. Just like Miranda, Kelly and Ilene had not dressed up, and simply wore their chef’s uniforms.

Kelly looked straight at Miranda. "After 'The France Night' incident I had to make sure that Ilene didn't go too far with the foreign foods."

Miranda laughed awkwardly at the angry stare she got from Kelly. "Come on, did you actually think I was going to eat frog legs and snails? What did you think all that salt was for?"

"Regardless of whose fault it was...*cough, cough*, Ilene, *cough*...we're all going to enjoy my cooking none the less, now lets all go get seated before things reach room temperature," Kelly said before turning towards the kitchen. "And I wouldn't want to keep everyone else waiting."

What unfortunate meal has been prepared for tonight?

Kelly and Ilene have prepared everyone their own meal, yours is a steak dish...prepared with red-wine...Nicole was wondering why you never drank on any of your dates.

Ilene was sneaky and prepared one foreign dish called cuy...she said it was some kind of pork, but before you enter the dining room, Beth pulls you aside and asks if she can 'talk' about you and Nicole, and if you’re happy with her.
15511122221211111122.title: Oh brother.

1552.content:
You walked up to the front door of the massive mansion that you would soon be calling home again. Once standing in front of the door you set your bags down and then raised a hand to knock, but stopped before it hit the door. You bent over and began to examine your reflection in the doorknob, though it wasn't the most practical last minute mirror, since it did make you look distorted and gold, but all you wanted to do was check to see that your hair was straight and that you hadn't gone over-board on your make up. 'I hope I'm not being vain, I just really want to make a good first impression, after all I am going to be spending a lot of my time with these girls...why am I trying to justify what I'm doing to myself? I know what I'm doing and why I'm doing it...I need to get out of my head more often...nope, still here.' You thought, still looking at your distorted reflection.

You stood there for a while making sure nothing about you would be off putting, but when the door suddenly opened you found yourself looking at a woman's very thin waist. You quickly straightened yourself out when you realized what you were looking at, but on it's way up, you felt head brushed against something. That 'something', was an unusually large pair of breast, that belonged to the woman, who was now blushing like mad.

"Oh, I'm so sorry miss." You apologized as your face started to go red, too.

The blush began to fade from the woman's face as awkward smile replaced it. "No, no, it's fine, that's not the first time...something, like that has has happened. *Eh-hm*, sorry, is there something I may help you with, miss?"

"Oh right, sorry, I'm Lisa-"

Your introduction was cut short when the woman bowed to you, her sudden movement causing her breast to bounce quite a bit. "Forgive me mistress, I didn't recognize you."

"Don't worry about it, how were you gonna recognize me in the first place, we've never met before. Uh, you don't have to do that any more." You said as your face started to go red from the...view, you were getting.

"Oh, sorry," The girl apologized before she stood straight again. "So...you don't recognize me either? ...Well, that's okay, I guess I've changed just as much as you have since we've last spoke."

"Sorry but, you're going to have to be more clear than that if you want me to remember."

"Right...well it wouldn't be as much fun if I just told you," The girl said before letting out a short giggle. "How about this, "Ms. Lisa, my mommy told me to wake you up!", remember now?"

"J-Jennifer? Is that you?" You asked surprised.

"Mm-hm, it's been a long time, hasn't it?"

"Yeah, I can't tell you how bad I feel that we fell so out of touch, but it's so great to see you now!" You said with a big smile.

"Well, it's my fault, too...so, would you like to come in, mistress?" Jennifer said before stepping aside to let you in.

You nodded your head and picked up your bags. "S-Sure, but stop calling me that, you never used to do it." You said before entering.

"Do you have anything you would like me to take up to your room?"

"No these are my only bags and I can handel them, I don't want to bother you with taking them to my room."

"Are you sure? It is my job to take care of you, it always has been."

"No, that was your mothers job, you were just too good of a friend."

"Well then how about I get you some tea, I just maid it?"

"Sure, if it's not too much trouble."

"Nothing is to much trouble for you. I'll go get it, why don't you go sit down in the living room and when I get back we can do some catching up, do you still remember where that is?"

"Of course, I'm just going to drop these of at my room first."

"Alright, you'll be staying in the master bed room now, don't worry we've moved your fathers stuff out and yours in." Jennifer said before leaving for the kitchen.

When Jennifer was gone you took your bags up to your old room and once putting them down you turned back around and turned back around and made your way to the living room. 'It's so good to see Jennifer again, she's really...developed, since I last saw her,' You thought as you sat down in the living room. 'She looks fantastic, she could really stand to gain some weight though, then she would look even-NO! I'm not going to think my friend that way, besides, she isn't like me...even if she did like girl's she wouldn't be like me, I told myself I wouldn't think about her that way but I still am!' Thankfully when Jennifer came into the room you were finally able to stop 'thinking like that'.

"Here you go, I hope it's good." Jennifer said as she handed you a cup and then sitting down next in the chair across from you.

"Thanks, so...are you the only one here? Because I haven't seen anyone else." You said before taking a sip of your tea.

"Yeah, every one else went out, I was supposed to go, too, but you were coming today so I stayed behind." Jennifer said before taking a sip from her own cup of tea.

"Oh, I'm sorry I kept you from having fun with your friends."

"No it's fine really, I think I was going to stay behind anyway. I had some stuff I wanted to do and as much as I love them all it's good to have some time to myself."

"Really, what kind of stuff?"

"Well, I've been trying to finish this one book, which I was finally able to do. I also took a bath, I've been so busy lately I've only had time to take showers and it was so nice just to relax! Then I..."

'Don't think about her taking a bath, don't think about her taking a bath! ...Damn it, or a shower that's worse!' You thought as Jennifer continued to talk.

"...and that's when I opened the door to see you standing there." Jennifer said warping up the story of her day.

"Oh that reminds me, what was with that whole bowing thing?"

"Your father told us all to start doing it."

You took a quick glance a Jennifer's chest, being careful not to look too long. "Yeah, that seems like something he would do."

"So, how have you been lately?"

"Oh, p-pretty good, nothing too exciting." You said smiling.

"Really? Hmm, do you have a boyfriend or anything?"

"N-No, I haven't had a boyfriend in a long time."

"Oh, still trying to find mister right?"

"Uhh, something like that."

"That's okay, do you have your eye on a guy though?"

"...No...what about you?"

"No, I don't, probably for a different reason than you though."

"W-What does that mean?"

"Well-"

"Jennifer?! What are you doing here?"

You and Jennifer switched your attention from each other to the doorway where you saw,

Ruby and Sophie. They stayed behind to get paper work ready for you and are now going to take you to do it.

Alex and Nicole. Alex stayed behind because she wasn't feeling to well, so Nicole stayed to keep her company.

Beth and Miranda. There's going to be a bad storm today and they stayed to get the plants covered or moved.
1552.title: Lisa.

info.brief_description: Fatten up the female staff that helps you run/maintain your estate.
info.description:
Authors note:I removed the rule about hiring male staff, you may now do so, as long as they don't do any gaining themselves

I have never done a story where you are experiencing the story through some one else's point of view or with this specific scenario so I thought that I might as well kill two birds with one stone and write this. I've been reading a lot of different story's from all over that are kind of like this and I'm not sure from which one I got this idea from but let's face it almost none of my story's are original and the ones that are don't usually turn out any good and I end up getting rid of them, but no matter how this one turn out I'm going to keep it on, because I just like the idea to much to get rid of it. Since I don't like male gaining, and still what a choice for a girl I put a lesbian girl as a choice. So any ways in this story you have recintly come into a large amount of money and you have just bought a brand new mansion, but after a month it has become to hard for you to maintain by your self and so you hire some help to make things easier while you work, and letting your subconscious's "pervy side" show hire a full female staff.

You can play as ether.
Norman.L, a nice, witty, smart, young man. You have never been quite good with the lady's and, despite trying you've never had "long term relationship" but that will eventually change with all these women around...hopefully.

Lisa.B, a sweet, innocent, young woman who likes other women. You have never be quite open about your sexuality with any one, but something about the sweet girls who now work for you makes you want to change that.

The woman who initially work for you are kind and will remain loyal and would never quit, and no matter how bad they could ever mess up you don't have the heart to fire them, any one else who might join your work force is a different story.

Rules

If you are Norman you can not gain any weight, but if you are Lisa that's okay.

You can have ether eventually have a monogamous or a non-monogamous relationship with these girls, ether way you have to end up with a least one of them.

The girls can get as fat as you want them to as long as they can still some how do their jobs.

They can only gain can in a way that someone "normaly" would.

Gaining on purpose is okay.

Nothing gross.

Sex is okay, just no writing about the details

No vore...EVER!

No male weight gain.

The original staff can not quit or get fired.

They can contemplate quitting if a problem arises, but you will convince them not to and that you will do every thing you can to resolve it.

They can do somthing that makes you want to fire them, but won't, and they can do something that make another girl want you to fire them, but you won't.

No weight loss, after all it's a weight gain story.

No having any one act to OOC.

No one in the story can die.

Please add a nice sized chapter.

This is kind of like a cartoon/anime, where time passes but no one rally ages for some strange reason.

They also somewhat act the like cartoon/anime charecter's but they are not.

Well that just about covers the rules (and if you Actually read all of this Bravo) and if your no sure if some thing is okay just as me before making a addition and I will tell you, or if you would like a exception to one of these rules just ask and I might allow it.
